comments: Good test ....BUT just a warning. It will change the volume settings on your phone. For me it left them on MAX, so I got painfully blasted out by my earphones when i went on to listen to music after running a hearing test. Really not good!

I really like idea .. but can it actually replace pure tone audiometry(although bone conduction not possible)..if yes then even paying a premium shouldn't be a problem Since we are using frequencies , what about monosyllables and checking speech reception threshold , speech discrimination score, sisi score, tone decay test. It doesn't need to be the exact thing ..just something that could be performed easily on opd hours as a screening

There are no instructions! Do I hold down 'I Can Hear" until the beeping stops or tap for each beep? Do I have to hit 'I Cannot Hear' once the beeping stops or can I just stop pressing 'I Can Hear'? When do I hit the Barely Audible button - when the sound is actually barely audible or is this just a badly named Confirm/Next button? Also I would prefer to use the Hide Results option but you cant pause. If I go into settings to select Hide Result, I miss beeps.

Works good. But the results can be deviated to the better ear thresholds if the person has asymmetrical thresholds. For eg. left ear has severe and right has normal hearing , the app displays erroneous results in poorer ear. Any suggestion for presentation of noise to better ear to avoid its participation?
This is wonderful, easy to read and use. it's results are closely accurate too. However I would suggest that naming of files should be enabled in the app to aid file differentiation. Thank you.

title: Oticon ON
description:
The Oticon ON App provides discreet remote control of your hearing aids, letting you adjust the volume of your hearing aids independently, switch between listening programs, keep an eye on your battery level or even help you find your hearing aids if you lose them. 
If enabled by your hearing care professional during the fitting session, the Oticon ON App can also let you access specific programs designed to help you move your attention away from your tinnitus. 

The Oticon ON App is also an easy way to handle wireless accessories paired with your hearing aids. Use it to control your Oticon TV Adapter, or devices such as Oticon EduMic or ConnectClip which can be used both for streaming and as remote microphones.

With the Oticon ON App, you can set personal listening goals and follow your daily hearing aid use through HearingFitness™. The Internet of Things feature lets you connect to a wide variety of Internet-connected solutions through the IFTTT service.

The Oticon ON App is compatible with all Oticon Bluetooth hearing aids.
We recommend using the latest version of Android OS.

To consult the latest list of compatible devices, please visit: https://www.oticon.com/support/compatibility

Please note the Oticon ON App will not enable you to use your hearing aids for direct audio streaming from your Android phone.

recentChanges:
Your Oticon ON App just got better!

To improve your experience, we regularly update the app to make it more reliable and easier to use.

In this release, we have listened to your feedback and added a new feature allowing you to manage your TV Adapters, and easily switch between them in the app.

Thank you for using the Oticon ON App!
comments: Update 10/9/20 Upgraded to Galaxy S10+ . Now the app only sees 1 of the aids. Troubleshooting is useless and Oticon does not have a Support number. Sad my hearing remains diminished! Won't pair with Bluetooth I use a Samsung Galaxy S5 mobile and a Samsung Chromebook Plus. This app just will not pair with Bluetooth no matter what I do. I remove and re-insert batteries, turn Bluetooth off and on again...nothing works. The user manual does not say much about this and only references Apple IOS.

I very much like the funtionality but this app is terrible with its BT connection. Pairing to my LG (less than 2 yrs old) is extremly difficult and unreliable. I dont belive Oticon is properly supporting android users like it does with apple phones. Also the BT connection to the TV is not reliable. Also why cant you stream phone calls and music without the need for the connect clip, which is awkward to use??. Apple users do not need a connect clip.

Hi, I've used this app for about 2 weeks now and would like to leave some tips and requests to its product team. My phone, Android, is a Samsung, less than 1 year old. 1. the app does not capture accurately the battery usage and loss. The % of use does not decrease daily. I get a replacement notice only when it is basically dead, when the device beeps. 2. the Hearing Fitness area also does not capture accurately the hours I use the device. For most days, it counts much less time than I used it (for instance, I use 10 hs and it counts 2hs.). It would be nice to see these two features working well. Thanks.

The app is nice. Works fine on my Samsung Galaxy J5 Pro (2017). Connected by turning on Bluetooth, starting the app, followed the prompts (open and closing the battery compartment when told), and it all connected. What would be nice, now, would be to enable audio pass through so when playing audio (through music apps or audiobooks) or video (e.g. YouTube) that it came through on the hearing aid. I'm not sure why this is taking so long to achieve since audio passthrough on Bluetooth is something that has been a capability for a long time now. Plus, Android occupies are fair size of the market, and not everyone has iPhones (or can afford them). So, please, we are literally begging you, enable media support/audio pass through for hearing aids connected to android phones (note: no, getting a connect clip is not the answer, as this another device to carry that can quite easily be lost).

21 October 2020. This issue has reappeared. Tried reinstall with no success. App appears to be broken in latest update on Galaxy S10. When I open the app I see a gray rectangle and nothing else. Sound control and listening environment settings in notification area still work. Pairing works too.

title: White Noise Lite
description:
AS SEEN IN CONSUMER REPORTS! Find out why the world is sleeping better with White Noise Free. Features ambient sounds of the environment that will help you relax during the day and sleep great at night.

Do you have trouble going to sleep? Are you traveling on a plane and need a quick power nap? Does your newborn baby wake up in the middle of the night? There are numerous benefits to using White Noise:

• Helps you sleep by blocking distractions
• Relaxes and reduces stress
• Pacifies fussy and crying babies
• Increases focus while enhancing privacy
• Soothes headaches and migraines
• Masks tinnitus (ringing of the ears)

Even when you’re asleep, your brain is constantly scanning and listening for sounds. If it’s too quiet, unwanted noises such as faucet drips or police sirens can interrupt your sleep. White Noise generates sounds over a wide range of frequencies, masking those noise interruptions, so you can not only fall asleep, but stay asleep.

SOUND CATALOG

40 sounds are included as part of the application (no downloading required unless you want more) including all the color noises (brown, white, pink, etc), mechanical sounds like a bedroom fan or air conditioner, light to heavy rains, rushing water sounds, beach and ocean waves, and so much more. For the entire list of sounds please visit our website. No streaming is required for playback.

APPLICATION FEATURES
• 40+ perfectly looped sounds with free downloads from the White Noise Market App and website at https://whitenoisemarket.com/
• Full support for Android 7.0 (Nougat) Multi-Window
• Background audio support so you can use other apps while listening
• Record, loop, and share new sounds
• Chromecast TV support for audio control and playback. (Note: Chromecast audio devices require using the Google Home app)
• Create new soundscapes by mixing multiple noises with support for adjusting volume, balance, and pitch of each individual sound in the mix
• Full screen digital clock with multiple colors and brightness controls makes it the perfect companion for any nightstand
• Advanced alarm and timer system that slowly fades audio in and out so you awake naturally feeling more refreshed
• On-screen media player and volume controls with swipe gesture support for navigating sound collection
• Star favorite sounds and mixes in the sound catalog for quick access using the Favorite view
• Designed to work on all Android-based phones and tablets
• Advanced Settings let you prevent interruptions such as notifications, tweak buffer size for optimal playback, adjust sound volume, balance, pitch, custom alarm snooze times, and more. All the pro tools you need for better sleep.

MEDIA REVIEWS

CONSUMER REPORTS: Smartphone Apps Can Sound as Good as a White-Noise Machine

DR. OZ SHOW: 13 Miracles of 2013: "Revolutionary Sound App!"

WASHINGTON POST: Smartphone Puts Newborn to Sleep: "For the next four months, the infant slept with his father's phone in his crib and White Noise tuned to 'air conditioner.' The monotonous buzz kept the baby sleeping soundly and his parents happy."

CNET: Apps that can improve your life: “Trouble falling asleep at night? A little White Noise might do the trick.”

UPGRADE TO FULL VERSION

Download the full version of White Noise for improved audio, more alarms, and no ads. Just tap the Upgrade button in settings.

Note: "White Noise Lite" was previously known as "White Noise Free"

WHITE NOISE MARKET

descriptionHTML:
AS SEEN IN CONSUMER REPORTS! Find out why the world is sleeping better with White Noise Free. Features ambient sounds of the environment that will help you relax during the day and sleep great at night.

Do you have trouble going to sleep? Are you traveling on a plane and need a quick power nap? Does your newborn baby wake up in the middle of the night? There are numerous benefits to using White Noise:

• Helps you sleep by blocking distractions
• Relaxes and reduces stress
• Pacifies fussy and crying babies
• Increases focus while enhancing privacy
• Soothes headaches and migraines
• Masks tinnitus (ringing of the ears)

Even when you’re asleep, your brain is constantly scanning and listening for sounds. If it’s too quiet, unwanted noises such as faucet drips or police sirens can interrupt your sleep. White Noise generates sounds over a wide range of frequencies, masking those noise interruptions, so you can not only fall asleep, but stay asleep.

SOUND CATALOG

40 sounds are included as part of the application (no downloading required unless you want more) including all the color noises (brown, white, pink, etc), mechanical sounds like a bedroom fan or air conditioner, light to heavy rains, rushing water sounds, beach and ocean waves, and so much more. For the entire list of sounds please visit our website. No streaming is required for playback.

APPLICATION FEATURES
• 40+ perfectly looped sounds with free downloads from the White Noise Market App and website at https://whitenoisemarket.com/
• Full support for Android 7.0 (Nougat) Multi-Window
• Background audio support so you can use other apps while listening
• Record, loop, and share new sounds
• Chromecast TV support for audio control and playback. (Note: Chromecast audio devices require using the Google Home app)
• Create new soundscapes by mixing multiple noises with support for adjusting volume, balance, and pitch of each individual sound in the mix
• Full screen digital clock with multiple colors and brightness controls makes it the perfect companion for any nightstand
• Advanced alarm and timer system that slowly fades audio in and out so you awake naturally feeling more refreshed
• On-screen media player and volume controls with swipe gesture support for navigating sound collection
• Star favorite sounds and mixes in the sound catalog for quick access using the Favorite view
• Designed to work on all Android-based phones and tablets
• Advanced Settings let you prevent interruptions such as notifications, tweak buffer size for optimal playback, adjust sound volume, balance, pitch, custom alarm snooze times, and more. All the pro tools you need for better sleep.

MEDIA REVIEWS

CONSUMER REPORTS: Smartphone Apps Can Sound as Good as a White-Noise Machine

DR. OZ SHOW: 13 Miracles of 2013: "Revolutionary Sound App!"

WASHINGTON POST: Smartphone Puts Newborn to Sleep: "For the next four months, the infant slept with his father's phone in his crib and White Noise tuned to 'air conditioner.' The monotonous buzz kept the baby sleeping soundly and his parents happy."

CNET: Apps that can improve your life: “Trouble falling asleep at night? A little White Noise might do the trick.”

UPGRADE TO FULL VERSION

Download the full version of White Noise for improved audio, more alarms, and no ads. Just tap the Upgrade button in settings.

Note: "White Noise Lite" was previously known as "White Noise Free"

WHITE NOISE MARKET

Download free sleep sounds from the White Noise Market at the following URL:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.tmsoft.whitenoise.market

comments: Great app! I use this app while studying. It helps me focus when the TV sound is loud.

this is perfect for my misophonia when i sleep! ive always had issues getting to sleep if i plug in my music to drown out my neighbour's tv at night, but this app has taken a major stress of my shoulders. it doesnt even have to be loud for it to work on me, which is extra helpful for my misophonia. my favourite is the thunderstorm and rain :)

I've used this app for years-- I'm almost completely dependent on "brown noise" to sleep. But lately it will stop in the middle of the night, which always wakes me up, and I'm not able to go back to sleep. Huge disappointment.

Ive used this app for quite a while and i love the combination sounds but am giving it up because it occasionally stops and then restarts. This will jar me out of a deep sleep and as i have sleep problems in general it often results in a sleepless night.
10/10 Would DEFINITELY recommend. This app is just awesome. It has never tried to flood me with ads and it's useful for when I sleep somewhere where I don't have access to sound.

title: Oto - Tinnitus Therapy & Self Treatment
description:
All the therapy you need to take control of your tinnitus. Oto brings together all the therapies known to be effective in tinnitus management into a progressive programme of cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT), targeted mindfulness, relaxation therapy and education. Get equipped with the skills you need to take complete control of your tinnitus.

Understand your tinnitus and how it is changing. Work through Oto’s therapy modules whilst filling in a hearing health log to see how your tinnitus improves over time. Oto harnesses the power of artificial intelligence to give you in depth insight into your tinnitus and hearing health in general, with quick and simple tracking.

------
Oto has been created by a dedicated team of doctors, scientists and tinnitus experts. We have decades of experience in managing tinnitus.

Oto allows you to access tinnitus therapy from the comfort of your own home, for a fraction of the cost of private therapy. No more long waiting lists, no more driving to appointments.
------
Do you want to learn how to control your tinnitus? Stop stress making your tinnitus worse? Calm the ringing in your ears before you sleep? Join our growing community of Oto pre-release testers and help us to shape the future of tinnitus treatment!


What’s inside:

★ Tinnitus therapy programme: everything you need to manage your tinnitus
★ Sound therapy: helping you to relax and sleep
★ Tinnitus and hearing tracking: see how your tinnitus improves over time


DISCLAIMER: Oto is still in alpha and as such has not been medically tested. Whilst we hope that it will help reduce the impact of your tinnitus, it should not be used as a substitute for, or replace professional medical advice, diagnosis or treatment. If you have any questions or concerns about your tinnitus or health in general, you should always consult with your doctor or audiologist. The use of any information provided in this app is solely at your own risk. 

Continue your tinnitus therapy journey with Oto on:
*Facebook: www.facebook.com/otohealthapp
*Twitter: www.twitter.com/otohealthapp
*LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/otohealth

title: Diapason for tinnitus
description:
Diapason helps you understand your tinnitus, re-educate your ears and follow your progress day after day!

In just 15 minutes a day, discover how to improve your daily life, and better control your hearing.

HOW IT WORKS
1. Perform your personalized Tinnitus Diagnosis in less than 10 minutes.
2. Discover your profile and learn more about the therapies that are right for you.
3. Dive free into the Capsules: advice from doctors and researchers specializing in the study of tinnitus.
4. Subscribe to access Diapason's therapeutic program: in 15 minutes a day, take advantage of 4 cutting-edge therapeutic approaches in the form of simple and fun activities.

THEY TALK ABOUT US
Femme actuelle (French magazine)
"One evening, I had the sensation of hearing a little less loud the crackle in my ears. It's a first! This perception pushed me to grant me this quarter of an hour daily to "heal" my tinnitus .. Today, I could not live without it!"
(This quote was translated from French)

Le Parisien (French newspaper)
"Through small games, the application allows the patient, in just a few minutes a day, to autonomously follow the entire process to a significant decrease in tinnitus in a few months."
(This quote was translated from French)

TERMS OF USE AND TARIFF
* Diapason offers within the application a subscription offer for one year (12 months) at €149.99.
* In the case of a subscription in another currency, this price may vary slightly due to the conversion fees applied by your banking institution of residence.
* The payment of your subscription will be charged to your account after the confirmation of your order.
* We do not have access to your payment details.
* The subscription is not renewed automatically at the end of the subscription period.
* Acoustic pulses are not equally effective for everyone, but you can try them for free.
* More details on our general terms of sale: https://diapason-app.com/terms/
We will gladly answer all your questions, queries, or simply to say hello, on contact@diapason-app.com

comments: It's not actually "in app purchase" model, but more like a frontend to a service. Treatment sounds are available only to subscribers, but you send your medical and personal info to them before knowing any of this. I'd say it's kinda scammy. Edit: as dev confirms, for free (in exchange of your medical plus contact info), you'll know you have tinnitus. Great, right!? "Hey, you can even listen to your tinnitus in our app, what more might you possibly want?"

So you ask for my information before i can even see what this app does. Then when I fill everything in and find the tinnitus profile i cannot use the even the basic sound for a limited time, to see if it helps some aspect, without immediately signing up. Thanks but no... +1 for the innovative slider.

I recently had an issue with the app that caused much consternation on my part, but customer service at Diapason quickly remedied the software glitch. I like the app and use it often to help tame my incessant tinnitus.
It's a good app but it's quite expensive!
Really cool. Like the approach. Have seen research articles. Great job !!!

comments: *edited* I used to really like this app but it has gotten buggy lately and now has obtrusive advertising. To change a sound it now pops up a loud obnoxious ad, not great right before bed when trying to relax. And the solution is to spend $50 to remove ads??? I can buy a sound machine for less than half that price 🙄 Nice app for drowning out noises. I like that you can combine different sounds and adjust the volume of each type of sound separately. Like you can have rain and add thunder

Technically, the app is great. It works well, has brilliant sound environments, looks good and definitely creates a pleasant, productive atmosphere. I would love to buy it, I do so many times with good apps to show my support for its developers, but I'm not giving €55 for this, it's a ridiculously high price.

As others have mentioned: BE CAREFUL! I almost accidentally tapped the $91 in-app purchase to remove ads. I have no idea why it costs that much, but there's a delay when you click the "x" on the advert and it's in the same position where the "Pay" button appears, so the lag made me tap again, just before the pay button appeared. This is partly a problem that Google Play should fix (add a few seconds where the Pay button is disabled), but it also seems very shady that they're charging that much to remove ads - I imagine there have been quite a few people who have accidentally bought it.

Have generally enjoyed the app but it recently started crashing when I try to close it and won't respond to "Close" function or device based "Close All". I literally have to restart my phone to get it to turn off. Good times. Now it's telling me that they want $50 for an ad free version. Cmon guys, think you may be getting a little big for your britches there. Its a digital noise maker and its not like you're dishing out royalties. 😑

I don't like it getting stuck on an ad for one minute when I first wake up, you should have the ad placement when I am turning it on not off and a pay option that isn't pure insanity. It likes to randomly shut off, I still haven't figured out why, I've had it on four phones and it's been a problem on all of them, but it's infrequent. Would also be really nice if it had a setting where other sounds could override it, such as voice-mail or a videocall.

title: AudioNotch
description:
AudioNotch's mobile app allows you to create and listen to Notched Sound Therapy that has been customized for your particular tinnitus frequency.

Tinnitus is the perception of sound in the absence of any external environmental sound. It affects millions of people worldwide, and usually presents as a persistent ringing in the ears. (4)

Notched Sound Therapy is a tinnitus treatment that can lower the volume of your tinnitus tone. It is created by taking either music or "white noise" and removing the sound energy—"notching it out"—at the same frequency of your tinnitus tone. (2) In some experiments, tinnitus volume was reduced by 75%, 26%, and 20%, respectively. (1,2,3)

FEATURES INCLUDE:
- The ability to match your tinnitus frequency using our tinnitus tuner (free, does not require an account)
- The ability to create Notched Sound Therapy customized for your particular tinnitus frequency (requires paid account)*
- The ability to listen to Notched Sound Therapy (requires paid account)

A paid AudioNotch account gives you full access to our mobile app and our web app. Through our web app, you can create and listen to the same Notched Sound Therapy audio files online.

*Notched White Noise and Notched Natural sounds can be created directly in the mobile app. However, creating Notched Music requires the usage of our web application on a computer (access to this is provided with the same paid account). Notched Music created via a computer can be listened to on the mobile app.

In order to learn more about the science behind AudioNotch and how it works, read our comprehensive F.A.Q. at https://www.audionotch.com/faq

REFERENCES:

1)
Lugli M, Romani R, Ponzi S, Bacciu S, Parmigiani S (2009) The windowed sound therapy: a new empirical approach for an effective personalized treatment of tinnitus. Int Tinnitus J 15:51-61.

2)
Okamoto H, Stracke H, Stoll W, Pantev C (2010) Listening to tailor-made notched music reduces tinnitus loudness and tinnitus-related auditory cortex activity. Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A 107: 1207-1210.

3)
Teismann, H., Okamoto, H., Pantev, C. (2011). Short and intense tailor-made notched music training against tinnitus: The tinnitus frequency matters. Plos ONE, 6, 1-8.

4)
Heller AJ (2003) Classification and epidemiology of tinnitus. Otolaryngol Clin North Am 36:239–248.

DISCLAIMER: THIS DESCRIPTION DOES NOT CONSTITUTE PROFESSIONAL MEDICAL ADVICE. SPEAK TO YOUR DOCTOR FIRST IF YOU HAVE TINNITUS. NEVER DISREGARD PROFESSIONAL MEDICAL ADVICE OR DELAY SEEKING MEDICAL TREATMENT BECAUSE OF SOMETHING YOU HAVE READ ON OR ACCESSED THROUGH THIS APP.
descriptionHTML:
AudioNotch's mobile app allows you to create and listen to Notched Sound Therapy that has been customized for your particular tinnitus frequency.

Tinnitus is the perception of sound in the absence of any external environmental sound. It affects millions of people worldwide, and usually presents as a persistent ringing in the ears. (4)

Notched Sound Therapy is a tinnitus treatment that can lower the volume of your tinnitus tone. It is created by taking either music or "white noise" and removing the sound energy—"notching it out"—at the same frequency of your tinnitus tone. (2) In some experiments, tinnitus volume was reduced by 75%, 26%, and 20%, respectively. (1,2,3)

FEATURES INCLUDE:
- The ability to match your tinnitus frequency using our tinnitus tuner (free, does not require an account)
- The ability to create Notched Sound Therapy customized for your particular tinnitus frequency (requires paid account)*
- The ability to listen to Notched Sound Therapy (requires paid account)

A paid AudioNotch account gives you full access to our mobile app and our web app. Through our web app, you can create and listen to the same Notched Sound Therapy audio files online.

*Notched White Noise and Notched Natural sounds can be created directly in the mobile app. However, creating Notched Music requires the usage of our web application on a computer (access to this is provided with the same paid account). Notched Music created via a computer can be listened to on the mobile app.

In order to learn more about the science behind AudioNotch and how it works, read our comprehensive F.A.Q. at https://www.audionotch.com/faq

REFERENCES:

1)
Lugli M, Romani R, Ponzi S, Bacciu S, Parmigiani S (2009) The windowed sound therapy: a new empirical approach for an effective personalized treatment of tinnitus. Int Tinnitus J 15:51-61.

2)
Okamoto H, Stracke H, Stoll W, Pantev C (2010) Listening to tailor-made notched music reduces tinnitus loudness and tinnitus-related auditory cortex activity. Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A 107: 1207-1210.

3)
Teismann, H., Okamoto, H., Pantev, C. (2011). Short and intense tailor-made notched music training against tinnitus: The tinnitus frequency matters. Plos ONE, 6, 1-8.

4)
Heller AJ (2003) Classification and epidemiology of tinnitus. Otolaryngol Clin North Am 36:239–248.

DISCLAIMER: THIS DESCRIPTION DOES NOT CONSTITUTE PROFESSIONAL MEDICAL ADVICE. SPEAK TO YOUR DOCTOR FIRST IF YOU HAVE TINNITUS. NEVER DISREGARD PROFESSIONAL MEDICAL ADVICE OR DELAY SEEKING MEDICAL TREATMENT BECAUSE OF SOMETHING YOU HAVE READ ON OR ACCESSED THROUGH THIS APP.
summary: AudioNotch creates Notched Sound Therapy, a treatment for tinnitus.

This is a small bugfix for the AudioNotch app.

If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to email us at support@audionotch.com or use the “Contact/Report A Bug” button in our app. We’re always looking to make this app even better, and we take your feedback seriously.
comments: Pretty good. Only been using it for a couple of days but I feel like it is helping. Though the app does crash every now and then when switching between apps. Also need to work on the UI for sound selection. I don't want to scroll a massive list. Would be nice if you could convert songs on the device itself too instead of relying on the Web app

This app is bait to sign you up for an account, after which the price for service will be disclosed. I don't like this deceptive type of business model and do not wish to support this developer. Uninstalling.
Free app, no trial, but instantly demands money? No. How do you manage to be more annoying than my tinnitus?
bait and switch.. no functionality without a paid account
Does not work.

title: White Noise for Tinnitus Relief
description:
When the world is full of distractions, and you desperately need to sleep, study or focus, this sound blocks out those noisy distractions. Create a calming ambience with the fan white noise.

This app is ideal for people who are tired, stressed, with insomnia and had a hard day of work. You will relax with smoothing music, beautiful songs used to relax and remove stress. Close your eyes, put on the headphones (For better result) and choose one of the sounds and relax or sleep better. 

This fan sound for sleep creates a relaxing white noise that blocks out distractions to help you fall asleep and remain sleeping all night long. The fan white noise is to help you sleep throughout the night. Fan sounds are the perfect sleep sounds because they effectively create sound masking so you are not disturbed while also creating a soothing ambience. Enjoy a night of great slumber!

Take a deep breath. Release your stress. Prepare yourself to relax and meditate with the best selection of HD Meditation Music that will help you find inner peace and calmness.

► Music to study, work, read and get focused :
The music to study of Musicoterapia is ideal to be able to focus in depth during the study and get the most out of it. It helps you concentrate, pay more attention, focus and work in a more efficient way. Our music to study contains brain waves, specifically Alpha waves, which increase concentration and the power of the brain to improve the memory and the intelligence. 


► Music of relaxation and meditation to calm the mind and control anxiety :
This type of music contains elements of a lot of cultures like: Japanese music, Indian music, Tibetan music, Chinese music, Shamanic music. Our music to meditate is also ideal for calm the mind, control anxiety, eliminate stress, stop thinking, etc.

► Relaxing music for spas and massages :
Our instrumental music is calm and soft. It’s a music that facilitates the complete relaxation of the body after a long day of work and helps the body to get into a total relax state. This music is perfect to be used in Spas and massages, since it contains relaxation relaxing sounds very soft that helps to relax both the body and mind.

Highlight features :-
---------------------
★ Select the song by clicking music icon at bottom of the screen
★ Select time slot to listen your favorite music
★ Selection among instruments and change at anytime
★ You can take control over volume just by dragging left and right seek bar on the screen.
★ Very simple UI and easy to understand.
★ Relaxation music for deep sleep, baby sleep and stress relief!
★ Excellent relaxation melodies with instrumental sounds!
★ Options for setting different time intervals!
★ Exquisite graphic design and intuitive controls!
★ Suitable for all generations of users!
★ Changes of image wih every music which gives new UI every time
★ Auto off music when timer ends
★ Perfect atmosphere to do mindfulness, kabbalah, reiki, taichí, yoga.
★ Soothing sounds to go to sleep with mp3 quality
★ Beautiful HD images to accompany the ambient sound and create perfect moments
★ Background music play

Our sounds to sleep free will not leave you indifferent. The ambient noise disappears and improve your health while you enjoy the music for meditation and sleep that we have prepared for you.


The purpose of this app is to relax the mind and body, and this app is ideal for babies, children, teenagers and adults that need relaxing music to reconcile the sleep.

title: WIDEX TONELINK
description:
Transform your smartphone into a multi-parameter remote control of your hearing aids. No need to carry a separate remote control device or to touch your hearing aids. Simply and discreetly adjust the key parameters of your hearing aid without the need of Bluetooth.
With the  TONELINK app you can easily:
    *Change programs
    *Adjust volume
    *Mute and unmute your hearing aid
    *Change directional focus to aid listening

How the  TONELINK app works
The  TONELINK app uses your phone's speaker to transmit acoustic control signals for the hearing aids. You have to pair your hearing aids with your phone the first time you use the app. Just follow the steps, and please note that you might need to adjust your phone volume for the app to work.
To ensure correct and safe operations:
    *This app is made for people with compatible WIDEX hearing aids fitted by a hearing care professional.
    *The sounds played by the phone may be audible by you and other people. The sound might be perceived as annoying by some people.
    *You can adjust the volume of these sounds by adjusting your phone volume to a level that is not annoyingly high and not too low for the hearing aids to pick up.
    *Do not use the app while the phone is directly by your or another person’s ears.
    *Do not use the app while connected to an external audio source.
    *This App is not tested on animals. Stop using the app if you notice any annoyed behavior from your pets when using it.

The  TONELINK app is compatible with the following WIDEX hearing aids:
    *WIDEX Evoke

WIDEX is continually listing more compatible devices. Please visit our website https://global.widex.com/en/support/tonelink-hearing-aid-app/compatibility
 for the latest devices we support.

recentChanges: Minor bugfixes.
comments: Since I've completed my fitting I can say, still, the app does its job flawlessly. I'm currently using skeleton molds as the hearing aids don't stay in my ears. I would, however, like the ability for the tone link app to be able to switch between zen+ programs, unless it's my hearing aids that are to blame. Other than that I'm happy.
This app was great for over a year, but they decide to updated today (bug fixes). Now I can't open the app. So much for bug fixes. App has now been fixed and is now working. Thank you

Up until last Tuesday worked a treat but now won't open, I have tried uninstalling and powering off my mobile then switching it back on, re installing app and it still wo't work Anyone have any suggestions or different app that does the same thing, not happy! Now Friday and very happy to say problem fixed thanks, happy again now 😁
Most of the time the directionality function does not work. After a couple of months I complained, so the audiologist changed all the internal electronics and the receiver. There was no im0rovement.

Working fine until today and now I cannot open the app! Development Team got back to me next day and provided an update which solved the issue Very impressive response Excellent service Thanks Oliver (Widex) Mike

title: White Noise Free
description:
There are numerous benefits to using White Noise:

✔ Helps you sleep by blocking distractions
✔ Pacifies fussy and crying babies
✔ Relaxes and reduces stress
✔ Increases focus while enhancing privacy
✔ Masks tinnitus (ringing of the ears)
✔ Soothes headaches and migraines

Even when you are asleep, your brain is constantly scanning and listening for sounds. Unwanted noises such as barking dogs or police sirens can interrupt your sleep. White Noise generates sounds over a wide range of frequencies, masking those noise interruptions, so you can not only fall asleep, but stay asleep.

Also from practical experience, we have learned that such white noise sounds are more effective as a lullaby for baby sleep than music, tones or sing.
Babies love white noise. Background white noise is calming for baby and resembles the kind of sounds that he would hear in the womb.

Simply select the desired sound or create your own mix using these sounds:

✔ Pure white noise
✔ Pure pink noise

comments: This is the perfect little sound machine in a mobile app to help me sleep living on a busy street with a lot of inner apartment noise and thin walls. There's a great variety of nature sounds and sample background noise with complete mixer options to layer the sounds and play with or without a timer. Truly a sleep saver and well designed app.

I love this app but hubby loves it more lol. I can finally turn the AC off when it's too cold and he doesn't complain about needing the noise. Once in a while the app turns off at night but I just turn it on when I notice. It's probably just my phone settings that I haven't figured out how to fix.

Wonderful app marred by ads that can't be removed. But all the sounds are spot on and there's a sleep timer. but dev, please release a Pro version or add IAP to free version so we can get rid of the ads that crowd the controls and ruin the look.
I love this app! It's easy to use, has lots of different sounds and you can layer them into hundreds of different combinations.
Nice. Plenty of choices. Permissions are not too invasive. Removed one star for not being SD card compatible...

title: H & T Sound Therapy
description:
Easy to use broadband noise player, which can be helpful to treat hyperacusis and/or tinnitus successfully if administered properly. It is also recommended for relaxing, improving concentration or as a help to go to sleep.


THREE COLORS OF NOISE
You can choose among pink noise, white noise or brown noise. All of them are high quality sounds with a bandwitdh of 1-22,050 Hz.

FINE VOLUME CONTROL 
Even the lowest volume of some devices can sound too loud for some hyperacusis sufferers. This app has a fine volume control that will let you adjust the volume to your needs, whatever they are. 

It also lets you adjust the volume with high precision so that the volume gap between one step and the next one is not a problem anymore.

BALANCE CONTROL
You can adjust the balance between the left and the the right channel. This may be helpful when there is some degree of hearing loss in one or both ears.

EQUALIZER
Some frequencies may be specially difficult to tolerate. This feature lets you adjust the gain of different frequency bands in order to meet your needs. It can also be used to modify the tone color of the noise and get a more pleasant sound for you.

AUDIO FADE IN
You can enable this feature to avoid sudden start playing, which may be annoying at a certain volume.

COUNT UP/DOWN TIMER
This app has a two-mode timer that will help you to control time of exposure.

ADS-FREE
This app is free and has no ads.

title: Quieten
description: Julian Cowan Hill got back to silence after twenty years of tinnitus. A combination of body-based therapies and practices to settle the nervous system, developing a clear understanding of how this symptom works and finding solid reassurance and advice on what helps let go of tinnitus gets you firmly onto the path to recovery. Quieten is packed full of practical advice, understanding, comforting information and many tips that will benefit you.

comments: You can get the same benefits of this app from his YouTube channel. I don't see the point of the subscription. If this man truly had a cure for tinnitus he would be known world wide by now. People, look into regenerative medicine. We'll likely have it this decade.

The app is causing my phone to crash, OK until I select a video clip to watch then completely freezes my phone so I have to do a full reboot.. Please look into this asap I'm on a new Samsung Galaxy s20

I had the free app, I subscribed and paid the 23€ for the Paid version but I don't see any additional content. Is it me or what? Why do you charge 23€ for no extra content? If I am misteken pls let me know how to have the additional content and I will obviously change my review.
This guy just goes around in circles rambling. He doesn't give you any solution. He only say "calm down. Tinnitus is stress" He dismisses most other causes. And he charges money!!

This guy only says "calm down" and beats around the bush. He has a huuge library of videos. How many do I need to watch? Apparently he's not content with ad revenue on yt and charges for this app too. This is a rip off.

title: Home Remedies For Tinnitus
description:
Tinnitus is the term that describes a condition that makes it seem as if there is a sound originating in the ears even when there are no apparent external noises. Tinnitus is not actually a disease but is a symptom of some other underlying condition.

Many health care professionals consider tinnitus to be a blessing in disguise. When tinnitus is present it can help detect an underlying disease or infection before it becomes aggravated. Once the cause is discovered the treatments are simple.

There are several different treatment options for tinnitus because of the various reasons for ringing in the ears. However, care should be used when treating tinnitus because some treatments can aggravate the conditions. For this reason, the best solutions are often home remedies for tinnitus that effectively control the ringing in the ears. Following you will find some of the common tinnitus home remedies

One of the very best tinnitus home remedies is your diet. Eat a fairly simple diet with few additional spices added to it. Work on reducing your consumption of saturated fats, salt, and sugar. Additionally, you should avoid drinking coffee and tea as this will worsen the pain.

Eat plenty of fresh fruits and green vegetables. This will reduce your suffering by improving your immune system. You can try chewing dry fruit to improve the blood circulation, which will go a long way toward curing tinnitus.

With daily exercise, you will stay mentally and physically fit. This will help reduce the risk of tinnitus occurring because it helps regulate your blood. Take only drugs that have been prescribed by your doctor as there are some drugs that tend to aggravate tinnitus.

When you go to bed at night, turn a radio on but detune it and place it near you as you sleep to help neutralize the inner noise. This is a very effective home remedy for tinnitus.

Loud noises are known to aggravate tinnitus so its best to avoid load noises such as traffic and those crowded public places. If these situations cannot be avoided, use ear plugs to control the decibel level of the noise that does enter your ears.

These are some very effective tinnitus home remedies that may help you quickly overcome the ringing noise in your ears without causing any unwanted side effects

Loud noises are known to aggravate tinnitus so its best to avoid load noises such as traffic and those crowded public places. If these situations cannot be avoided, use ear plugs to control the decibel level of the noise that does enter your ears.

These are some very effective tinnitus home remedies that may help you quickly overcome the ringing noise in your ears without causing any unwanted side effects
summary: Learn How To Use Home Remedies For Tinnitus To Cure The Condition

title: AudioNotch
description:
AudioNotch's mobile app allows you to create and listen to Notched Sound Therapy that has been customized for your particular tinnitus frequency.

Tinnitus is the perception of sound in the absence of any external environmental sound. It affects millions of people worldwide, and usually presents as a persistent ringing in the ears. (4)

Notched Sound Therapy is a tinnitus treatment that can lower the volume of your tinnitus tone. It is created by taking either music or "white noise" and removing the sound energy—"notching it out"—at the same frequency of your tinnitus tone. (2) In some experiments, tinnitus volume was reduced by 75%, 26%, and 20%, respectively. (1,2,3)

FEATURES INCLUDE:
- The ability to match your tinnitus frequency using our tinnitus tuner (free, does not require an account)
- The ability to create Notched Sound Therapy customized for your particular tinnitus frequency (requires paid account)*
- The ability to listen to Notched Sound Therapy (requires paid account)

A paid AudioNotch account gives you full access to our mobile app and our web app. Through our web app, you can create and listen to the same Notched Sound Therapy audio files online.

*Notched White Noise and Notched Natural sounds can be created directly in the mobile app. However, creating Notched Music requires the usage of our web application on a computer (access to this is provided with the same paid account). Notched Music created via a computer can be listened to on the mobile app.

In order to learn more about the science behind AudioNotch and how it works, read our comprehensive F.A.Q. at https://www.audionotch.com/faq

REFERENCES:

1)
Lugli M, Romani R, Ponzi S, Bacciu S, Parmigiani S (2009) The windowed sound therapy: a new empirical approach for an effective personalized treatment of tinnitus. Int Tinnitus J 15:51-61.

2)
Okamoto H, Stracke H, Stoll W, Pantev C (2010) Listening to tailor-made notched music reduces tinnitus loudness and tinnitus-related auditory cortex activity. Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A 107: 1207-1210.

3)
Teismann, H., Okamoto, H., Pantev, C. (2011). Short and intense tailor-made notched music training against tinnitus: The tinnitus frequency matters. Plos ONE, 6, 1-8.

4)
Heller AJ (2003) Classification and epidemiology of tinnitus. Otolaryngol Clin North Am 36:239–248.

DISCLAIMER: THIS DESCRIPTION DOES NOT CONSTITUTE PROFESSIONAL MEDICAL ADVICE. SPEAK TO YOUR DOCTOR FIRST IF YOU HAVE TINNITUS. NEVER DISREGARD PROFESSIONAL MEDICAL ADVICE OR DELAY SEEKING MEDICAL TREATMENT BECAUSE OF SOMETHING YOU HAVE READ ON OR ACCESSED THROUGH THIS APP.

This app is ideal for people who are tired, stressed, with insomnia and had a hard day of work. You will relax with smoothing music, beautiful songs used to relax and remove stress. Close your eyes, put on the headphones (For better result) and choose one of the sounds and relax or sleep better. 

This fan sound for sleep creates a relaxing white noise that blocks out distractions to help you fall asleep and remain sleeping all night long. The fan white noise is to help you sleep throughout the night. Fan sounds are the perfect sleep sounds because they effectively create sound masking so you are not disturbed while also creating a soothing ambience. Enjoy a night of great slumber!

Take a deep breath. Release your stress. Prepare yourself to relax and meditate with the best selection of HD Meditation Music that will help you find inner peace and calmness.

► Music to study, work, read and get focused :
The music to study of Musicoterapia is ideal to be able to focus in depth during the study and get the most out of it. It helps you concentrate, pay more attention, focus and work in a more efficient way. Our music to study contains brain waves, specifically Alpha waves, which increase concentration and the power of the brain to improve the memory and the intelligence. 


► Music of relaxation and meditation to calm the mind and control anxiety :
This type of music contains elements of a lot of cultures like: Japanese music, Indian music, Tibetan music, Chinese music, Shamanic music. Our music to meditate is also ideal for calm the mind, control anxiety, eliminate stress, stop thinking, etc.

► Relaxing music for spas and massages :
Our instrumental music is calm and soft. It’s a music that facilitates the complete relaxation of the body after a long day of work and helps the body to get into a total relax state. This music is perfect to be used in Spas and massages, since it contains relaxation relaxing sounds very soft that helps to relax both the body and mind.

Highlight features :-
---------------------
★ Select the song by clicking music icon at bottom of the screen
★ Select time slot to listen your favorite music
★ Selection among instruments and change at anytime
★ You can take control over volume just by dragging left and right seek bar on the screen.
★ Very simple UI and easy to understand.
★ Relaxation music for deep sleep, baby sleep and stress relief!

The purpose of this app is to relax the mind and body, and this app is ideal for babies, children, teenagers and adults that need relaxing music to reconcile the sleep.

title: WIDEX TONELINK
description:
Transform your smartphone into a multi-parameter remote control of your hearing aids. No need to carry a separate remote control device or to touch your hearing aids. Simply and discreetly adjust the key parameters of your hearing aid without the need of Bluetooth.
With the  TONELINK app you can easily:
    *Change programs
    *Adjust volume
    *Mute and unmute your hearing aid
    *Change directional focus to aid listening

How the  TONELINK app works
The  TONELINK app uses your phone's speaker to transmit acoustic control signals for the hearing aids. You have to pair your hearing aids with your phone the first time you use the app. Just follow the steps, and please note that you might need to adjust your phone volume for the app to work.
To ensure correct and safe operations:
    *This app is made for people with compatible WIDEX hearing aids fitted by a hearing care professional.
    *The sounds played by the phone may be audible by you and other people. The sound might be perceived as annoying by some people.
    *You can adjust the volume of these sounds by adjusting your phone volume to a level that is not annoyingly high and not too low for the hearing aids to pick up.
    *Do not use the app while the phone is directly by your or another person’s ears.
    *Do not use the app while connected to an external audio source.
    *This App is not tested on animals. Stop using the app if you notice any annoyed behavior from your pets when using it.

The  TONELINK app is compatible with the following WIDEX hearing aids:
    *WIDEX Evoke

WIDEX is continually listing more compatible devices. Please visit our website https://global.widex.com/en/support/tonelink-hearing-aid-app/compatibility
 for the latest devices we support.

comments: Since I've completed my fitting I can say, still, the app does its job flawlessly. I'm currently using skeleton molds as the hearing aids don't stay in my ears. I would, however, like the ability for the tone link app to be able to switch between zen+ programs, unless it's my hearing aids that are to blame. Other than that I'm happy.
This app was great for over a year, but they decide to updated today (bug fixes). Now I can't open the app. So much for bug fixes. App has now been fixed and is now working. Thank you

Up until last Tuesday worked a treat but now won't open, I have tried uninstalling and powering off my mobile then switching it back on, re installing app and it still wo't work Anyone have any suggestions or different app that does the same thing, not happy! Now Friday and very happy to say problem fixed thanks, happy again now 😁
Most of the time the directionality function does not work. After a couple of months I complained, so the audiologist changed all the internal electronics and the receiver. There was no im0rovement.

Working fine until today and now I cannot open the app! Development Team got back to me next day and provided an update which solved the issue Very impressive response Excellent service Thanks Oliver (Widex) Mike

title: White Noise Free
description:
There are numerous benefits to using White Noise:

✔ Helps you sleep by blocking distractions
✔ Pacifies fussy and crying babies
✔ Relaxes and reduces stress
✔ Increases focus while enhancing privacy
✔ Masks tinnitus (ringing of the ears)
✔ Soothes headaches and migraines

Even when you are asleep, your brain is constantly scanning and listening for sounds. Unwanted noises such as barking dogs or police sirens can interrupt your sleep. White Noise generates sounds over a wide range of frequencies, masking those noise interruptions, so you can not only fall asleep, but stay asleep.

Also from practical experience, we have learned that such white noise sounds are more effective as a lullaby for baby sleep than music, tones or sing.
Babies love white noise. Background white noise is calming for baby and resembles the kind of sounds that he would hear in the womb.

comments: This is the perfect little sound machine in a mobile app to help me sleep living on a busy street with a lot of inner apartment noise and thin walls. There's a great variety of nature sounds and sample background noise with complete mixer options to layer the sounds and play with or without a timer. Truly a sleep saver and well designed app.

I love this app but hubby loves it more lol. I can finally turn the AC off when it's too cold and he doesn't complain about needing the noise. Once in a while the app turns off at night but I just turn it on when I notice. It's probably just my phone settings that I haven't figured out how to fix.

Wonderful app marred by ads that can't be removed. But all the sounds are spot on and there's a sleep timer. but dev, please release a Pro version or add IAP to free version so we can get rid of the ads that crowd the controls and ruin the look.
I love this app! It's easy to use, has lots of different sounds and you can layer them into hundreds of different combinations.

title: H & T Sound Therapy
description:
Easy to use broadband noise player, which can be helpful to treat hyperacusis and/or tinnitus successfully if administered properly. It is also recommended for relaxing, improving concentration or as a help to go to sleep.


THREE COLORS OF NOISE
You can choose among pink noise, white noise or brown noise. All of them are high quality sounds with a bandwitdh of 1-22,050 Hz.

FINE VOLUME CONTROL 
Even the lowest volume of some devices can sound too loud for some hyperacusis sufferers. This app has a fine volume control that will let you adjust the volume to your needs, whatever they are. 

It also lets you adjust the volume with high precision so that the volume gap between one step and the next one is not a problem anymore.

BALANCE CONTROL
You can adjust the balance between the left and the the right channel. This may be helpful when there is some degree of hearing loss in one or both ears.

EQUALIZER
Some frequencies may be specially difficult to tolerate. This feature lets you adjust the gain of different frequency bands in order to meet your needs. It can also be used to modify the tone color of the noise and get a more pleasant sound for you.

AUDIO FADE IN
You can enable this feature to avoid sudden start playing, which may be annoying at a certain volume.

COUNT UP/DOWN TIMER
This app has a two-mode timer that will help you to control time of exposure.

ADS-FREE
This app is free and has no ads.

title: Quieten
description: Julian Cowan Hill got back to silence after twenty years of tinnitus. A combination of body-based therapies and practices to settle the nervous system, developing a clear understanding of how this symptom works and finding solid reassurance and advice on what helps let go of tinnitus gets you firmly onto the path to recovery. Quieten is packed full of practical advice, understanding, comforting information and many tips that will benefit you.

title: Home Remedies For Tinnitus
description:
Tinnitus is the term that describes a condition that makes it seem as if there is a sound originating in the ears even when there are no apparent external noises. Tinnitus is not actually a disease but is a symptom of some other underlying condition.

Many health care professionals consider tinnitus to be a blessing in disguise. When tinnitus is present it can help detect an underlying disease or infection before it becomes aggravated. Once the cause is discovered the treatments are simple.

There are several different treatment options for tinnitus because of the various reasons for ringing in the ears. However, care should be used when treating tinnitus because some treatments can aggravate the conditions. For this reason, the best solutions are often home remedies for tinnitus that effectively control the ringing in the ears. Following you will find some of the common tinnitus home remedies

One of the very best tinnitus home remedies is your diet. Eat a fairly simple diet with few additional spices added to it. Work on reducing your consumption of saturated fats, salt, and sugar. Additionally, you should avoid drinking coffee and tea as this will worsen the pain.

Eat plenty of fresh fruits and green vegetables. This will reduce your suffering by improving your immune system. You can try chewing dry fruit to improve the blood circulation, which will go a long way toward curing tinnitus.

With daily exercise, you will stay mentally and physically fit. This will help reduce the risk of tinnitus occurring because it helps regulate your blood. Take only drugs that have been prescribed by your doctor as there are some drugs that tend to aggravate tinnitus.

When you go to bed at night, turn a radio on but detune it and place it near you as you sleep to help neutralize the inner noise. This is a very effective home remedy for tinnitus.

Loud noises are known to aggravate tinnitus so its best to avoid load noises such as traffic and those crowded public places. If these situations cannot be avoided, use ear plugs to control the decibel level of the noise that does enter your ears.

These are some very effective tinnitus home remedies that may help you quickly overcome the ringing noise in your ears without causing any unwanted side effects

title: WIDEX MOMENT
description:
For decades, the hearing aid industry has been forced to accept that, no matter how good a hearing aid is, it will always sound like a hearing aid.

FROM THIS MOMENT, ALL OTHER HEARING AIDS WILL BE COMPARED TO THIS ONE.

With the MOMENT app you can:
- Personalize your listening experience
- Let the hearing aid automatically adapt to your needs
- Adjust hearing aid volume and mute hearing aids
- Adjust directional focus to aid listening
- Create personal programs with your sound adjustments
- Add locations to programs for automatic selection
- Adjust the pitch of the sound (bass, middle and treble) using the equalizer
- Access “Help” and troubleshooting tips in the app
- Access the “Find my hearing aid” feature

We continuously update our device compatibility list. Please visit our website to see the latest devices we support: https://global.widex.com/en/support/moment-hearing-aid-app/compatibility

Product number: 5 300 0022

In case of a serious incident, report the occurrence to the manufacturer of the device.

summary: Allows users to connect to their hearing aid and control hearing aid functions.
recentChanges:
- Bug fixes and performance improvements.
- The ability to pair your hearing aids from inside the app.
- Support for Huawei devices.
comments: I have a bit to say on this app. I love the idea of being able to control and fine-tune my hearing aids, but the usage is far from an optimal experience. I have an older Android, Google Pixel, running Q which when I installed the app was the latest OS available. In general, the app seems to regularly have trouble connecting and staying connected to both hearing aids. Often, I'll open the app and it's connected to one but not the other (it's usually connected to the right, not the left). It doesn't search for the left and there's no way to force the search in the app. Sometimes it's a matter of closing and re-opening the app, sometimes it's a matter of force stop and restart before it connects again. Then there's the rare but not rare enough issue of the app "forgetting" my hearing aids all together. The app opens and tells me no hearing aids are connected. No amount of restarting makes them find my hearing aids and I need to pair them again. When I'm home this isn't a "big deal", but in general, I'm adjusting my hearing aids because of a change in my environment, and having to stop to deal with a screwy app means I'm paying attention to the wrong thing. I've created some favorites. I've experimented with using GPS - I have a job with a decent amount of ambient noise so I have a setting I use at work and set the GPS location to the office. I gave the app Location permission no matter whether I'm using the app or not. To date - about a month of use - it has NEVER automatically switched when I arrive at the office, and I've given it time. This isn't a third party app, and I wonder how much Widex cares - they don't update the app with any consistency. They should recognize that the users that use the app are tech savvy and want this level of control and want it to just work. I have fewer issues with my Fitbit, and that's syncing constantly. When the app works, it works fairly well, but that's less often than 50% of the time. I do wish there was more education in the app - I can switch to Pure or Universal, but a well written app would give me an indication of what these settings do. For example, "Better for a crowded restaurant" or "Enhances Speech". Anything would be better than switching blindly and trying to listen for the subtle nuanced differences. Come on, Widex, get it together. For what hearing Aids cost, the app should not be their Achilles Heel.

Like many of the reviews have mentioned I am not having much success with retaining connectivity with the ear pieces. I have an android phone. The software looks impressive but I am not able to utilise the capabilities of the product because of connectivity issue. It is very dissapointing as these are top of the range aids. It is rather pointless having customised programs for different situations when it takes 10-15 minutes to get it functioning.

Contrary to the negative reviews, I'm having zero issues. The in-app pairing was simple, the sound customization options are great (I'll be playing with that for a while!). Once the streaming feature update comes to Android, 5 stars!

Won't connect to my Moto G4 phone which is Android 7.0. Sees my 330 Moment hearing aids but always fails to pair. Zen Tinnitus and Tonelink apps both pair and work. Pairs and works with my Samsung Galaxy Tab A tablet which is on Android 8.1.0 and I can create additional profiles to use other than the default Universal and Music, however no matter which new profile I have it on, the hearing aids also default back to Universal when I recharge them so is this hearing aids firmware or Moment app?

When connected, works good. The issue is it takes 5 minutes or longer of un-pairing, re-paring, launching the app, closing the app. Very inconsistent and this will affect my decision on keeping or returning the Widex Moment aid. I have an Andriod btw... Update: Stopping and starting bluetooth helps but overall, this app is very unreliable. An update for Android is needed.

title: Sleep Sounds - Relax Music and White Noise
description:
Sleep sounds also called white noise can help you if you suffer from insomnia, tinnitus if you have trouble falling asleep.

App can help you relax and unwind and sleep more quickly and efficiently with these sounds to sleep.

Sounds / white noise for sleepSome noises such as "white" noise or permanent background noise (splashing rain, waves, fan white noise, etc...) can help you fall asleep. A meaningless noise will not wake you up.

Available sleep sounds free and white noise
Our many sounds are classified into different sounds categories.

Rain sounds: Relax rain or heavy rain sound, rain on windows, rain on tents, rain on roof, thunder sound or rain on the car.
Nature's sounds: In nature we have sounds like waves, stream, waterfall noise, or the sound of the wind in the leaves.
Animals sounds: cat purring, seagull, frog, birds, crickets or owl.
Home noises: The usual noises that can be found in a house, such as a fan white noise, shower, vacuum cleaner, washing machine, clock or hair dryer.
Urban noises: Noise from outside such as crowds, construction, or traffic.
Transportation noises: The sounds of a train running on rails, browning in a plane, the subway, or a boat trip.
White Noises: Here you can find white noise, pink noise as well as brown noise.

100% offline sleep sounds : You can leave the phone close by activating the aircraft mode, because it's 100% offline app.

When to use sleep sounds👶 Calm and put baby to sleep crying baby
👍 Take a nap
👍 Deep sleep
👍 Relieve tinnitus
👍 Isolate yourself from a noisy environment
👍 Improve concentration
👍 Decrease insomnia

👍 Eliminate anxiety and daily stress
👍 To facilitate falling asleep

comments: Great app, it really helps to mask my tinnitus when I'm trying to sleep. Unfortunately, the infra sound, which is the one I wish to use the most, has a noticable clicking sound in it about every 20 to 25 seconds.
Great app. Very effective for creating a calm and serene presence for relaxation.
Love it.. n the frying sound is so good. Anyway I would also love to listen to hot steak cutting sound would be fantastic if u add this . It sounds delicious
Good relaxation. Love the sleep timer and like that it has a dark mode and the ability to add, take away and modify sounds.

All in all, though, I think you have done an excellent job and I will definitely be using your app on a regular basis. Definitely 2 thumbs up from me.

title: AudioCardio: Ear Training and Hearing Test
description:
AudioCardio’s data and science backed solution allows you to check your hearing and generate a personalized sound therapy (inaudible) that aims to maintain and strengthen your ears.
 
Our proprietary sound therapy is like physical therapy for your hearing. It's a once a day, one hour, sound therapy (inaudible) that you can use while doing other activities like listening to music or watching tv.
 
“...potential to revolutionize the way hearing loss is treated.”- Health Radar
 
“...works like physical therapy for your ears!”- CNET
 
“I’ve been wearing my hearing aids for more than a decade...the longer I use the app the better I can hear! - Robert F., 74” - Health Radar
 
Using Threshold Sound Conditioning™ technology (TSC), our sound therapy stimulates the inner ear cells to target damaged hearing for each ear.
 
TSC technology was clinically proven with:
 
Stanford Univ.
Samsung Medical Center
Palo Alto Medical Foundation
Nanjing Univ.
Chung Ang Univ.
 
APP FEATURES
 
• Sound therapy that aims to help maintain, protect and strengthen hearing
• Fast hearing check that creates a personalized sound therapy for your ears
• Generates hearing score, usage metrics and identifies targeted frequencies for each ear
• Integrates with music, streaming services and other daily activities
 
Allows you to test hearing, create a personalized sound therapy, track progress for each ear and can be used as a complementary solution to your hearing aid (s).
 
This is not a clinical hearing test, but it is a great way to do an initial hearing screening to better understand your hearing loss, promote better ear health, and healthy hearing habits.
 
Over 450M people suffer from hearing loss and over 300M people suffer from tinnitus or ringing in the ears. Tinnitus can be a symptom of hearing loss and hearing loss is a problem that often goes undiagnosed. It is known as an invisible disease / disability. Current solutions like hearing aids and are hard to access or too expensive for a majority of the population with hearing loss. This may be why people wait an average of 7 years before they get a hearing test from a hearing health professional.
 
SUBSCRIPTION PRICING AND TERMS
 
AudioCardio offers 3 auto-renewing subscription options:
 
$14.99 /mo
$64.99 6 months
$99.99 per year
Payment will be charged to the credit card connected to your Google Play Store Account when you confirm the initial subscription purchase. Your subscription will automatically renew unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24 hours before the end of the current period. Your account will be charged for renewal within 24 hours prior to the end of the current period, and the cost of the renewal will be identified. You may manage your subscription and auto-renewal may be turned off by going to your Account Settings after the purchase. Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when you purchase a subscription, where applicable.
 
This price is for the United States. Pricing in other countries vary and may be converted to your local currency depending on your country of residence.
 
Terms & Conditions
https://audiocardio.com/terms-of-use-terms/
 
Privacy Policy
https://audiocardio.com/audio-cardio-privacy-policy/
 
*Disclaimer*
This isn’t a clinical hearing test. This should be considered a hearing check or screening and cannot be used to prescribe a hearing aid. It should only be used as a method to see if you may have hearing loss since it is not a clinical hearing test.
 
This isn’t a medical device and hasn’t been reviewed by the FDA as a hearing loss solution. It’s not intended to self-diagnose any disease, injury or disability like tinnitus or hearing loss. If you believe you have hearing loss or tinnitus, please consult your doctor, or other qualified healthcare professional before using this app. Use this app at your own risk. AudioCardio™ does not take responsibility for direct or indirect damage that could result from its use.

recentChanges: Minor design updates
comments: I have tinnitus and I find that this app helps to calm it down and make it less volatile. I also did experience a 10 db improvement in 2 frequencies in my left ear, which is my worse ear. I got the improvement though by just focusing one frequency. I personally beleive the "cardio" helps to link still intact hair cells in the ear to synapse nerves that may have been damaged. Definately worth the 2 week trial. Use it everyday, at least one hour per day. You should see a good result!

Great app for hearing loss. My son told me about it and after using it for about 4 weeks I'm noticing a HUGE DIFFERENCE! Admittedly I wasnt using it everyday, but even 4/5 days a weeks ended up helping my hearing. Def worth a shot and there's a free trial too. Hoping this keeps improving my hearing.

I experienced a huge increase in tinnitus after only one session. This doesn't help restore hearing for me, it only increases the ringing in my ears. Did not expect this side effect. Please put a warning in the description.
Simply a amazing app who knew that I could improve my hearing by exercising my hearing with audio frequencies.

I used to go to a lot of concerts and noticed it affected my hearing. I started using AudioCardio to help with my hearing loss due to excessive loud noise and have noticed that I’m not straining to hear as much.

title: Advanced Tinnitus Therapy For Seniors
description: Seniors are more likely to have both age related hearing loss and tinnitus, and although both can often be helped by a hearing aid some people need more help to reduce the tinnitus from their consciousness.  This app provides affected seniors - who have monotone tinnitus - with a totally free research based package of practical help and information including a personal Residual Inhibition (RI) tone tool that allows most users to turn off their tinnitus briefly - a useful aid, especially for sleeping.  A dual tone test also allows the user to match their tinnitus pitch frequency which is then applied to a modern technique called 'tailor-made music notching'.  Further tools include live web connections to assess tinnitus severity and also to test for age related hearing loss.  This app includes suggested day/night routines and equipment based on a variety of audio therapy types, relaxation exercises and Cognitive Behaviour Therapy (CBT) . The user is directed to free specific tinnitus and related CBT apps that support the daily routines by notching personal music in real time, provide relaxing guided imagery audio and offer a CBT Diary that encourages positivity.  Instructions are included for creating a portable personal Residual Inhibition tone MP3 track and portable tailored 'notched' music MP3 tracks using the free open source 'Audacity' software on a computer.  Buying cheaper discreet 'Completely In Canal' instant fit 8 channel, fully automatic, good quality hearing aids on the web is covered along with a related hearing aid volume control Android phone app.

title: Frequency Generator - Audio Tools & Ultrasound
description:
Frequency Generator packs ten high-quality and user-friendly signal generation tools:
• Single frequency
• Multi frequencies
• Musical notes
• Binaural beats
• Frequency sweep generator
• Noise generator
• Bass/Subwoofers test
• Speaker cleaner
• DTMF tones
• Sound effects generator

Common use-cases
• Make your own audio experiments.
• Test your hearing: On average, humans hear frequencies between 20 Hz and 20000 Hz, but the hearing can deteriorate with age, especially for frequencies close to ultrasound.
• Find and attempt to mask your tinnitus frequency.
• Tune your musical instruments.
• Relax with binaural beats or white noise.
• Remove water from your phone speaker by generating sound waves in a specific frequency range.
• Play and export randomly generated sound effects. Export requires Android 6.0+.
• Discover how your audio setup handles frequency sweeps ranging from very low frequencies to near ultrasounds.
• ...or you can have fun by generating police sirens, cartoonish fall sound effects, etc.

Notes
• This app generates frequencies from 1 Hz (infrasound) to 22000 Hz (ultrasound), and supports decimal values (e.g. 7.83 Hz).
• Available waveforms for the generated signal are: sine, square, triangle and sawtooth.
• Visit the settings to customize the sound generator behaviour: define a timer, enable octave buttons, and more.
• Save your favorite signals as presets via the top-right menu.
• Several studies have found that ultrasounds are not an effective solution to repel mosquitoes. If you still want to use this app as a mosquito repellent, you should know that anti mosquito apps merely generate ultrasounds or near ultraounds (between 15000 Hz and 22000 Hz).
• Keep in mind that the generated tones can be very annoying and irritating for your surroundings. Always use this application responsibly. Also, keep the audio volume reasonably low to avoid damaging your hearing or your audio devices. If you rise the volume to better hear very low frequencies, don't forget to lower the volume afterwards before playing higher frequencies: the perceived volume of a tone depends on its frequency.
• When generating ultrasonic tones (20000 Hz +) speakers may produce additional parasitic sounds.
