• Binaural beats
• Frequency sweep generator
• Noise generator
• Bass/Subwoofers test
• Speaker cleaner
• DTMF tones
• Sound effects generator

Common use-cases
• Make your own audio experiments.
• Test your hearing: On average, humans hear frequencies between 20 Hz and 20000 Hz, but the hearing can deteriorate with age, especially for frequencies close to ultrasound.
• Find and attempt to mask your tinnitus frequency.
• Tune your musical instruments.
• Relax with binaural beats or white noise.
• Remove water from your phone speaker by generating sound waves in a specific frequency range.
• Play and export randomly generated sound effects. Export requires Android 6.0+.
• Discover how your audio setup handles frequency sweeps ranging from very low frequencies to near ultrasounds.
• ...or you can have fun by generating police sirens, cartoonish fall sound effects, etc.

Notes
• This app generates frequencies from 1 Hz (infrasound) to 22000 Hz (ultrasound), and supports decimal values (e.g. 7.83 Hz).
• Available waveforms for the generated signal are: sine, square, triangle and sawtooth.
• Visit the settings to customize the sound generator behaviour: define a timer, enable octave buttons, and more.
• Save your favorite signals as presets via the top-right menu.
• Several studies have found that ultrasounds are not an effective solution to repel mosquitoes. If you still want to use this app as a mosquito repellent, you should know that anti mosquito apps merely generate ultrasounds or near ultraounds (between 15000 Hz and 22000 Hz).
• Keep in mind that the generated tones can be very annoying and irritating for your surroundings. Always use this application responsibly. Also, keep the audio volume reasonably low to avoid damaging your hearing or your audio devices. If you rise the volume to better hear very low frequencies, don't forget to lower the volume afterwards before playing higher frequencies: the perceived volume of a tone depends on its frequency.
• When generating ultrasonic tones (20000 Hz +) speakers may produce additional parasitic sounds.
summary: Ten free audio tools gathered in one app! Tone generator, sound tests and more!
developerAddress:
15 Square Amiral André Roux
35700 Rennes - France
recentChanges:
• Added audio balance and volume controls.
• Added a setting to control the behaviour of a long-press on the +/- buttons in Single oscillator and Multi-oscillators modes.
• You can now change the base tuning frequency for musical notes via the top-right menu (e.g. A₄ = 432Hz).
• Reworked the system controlling the amplitude of the signal: No longer follow an equal-loudness contour.
• Improved Android 10 support.
• More UI and technical improvements.
comments: It's cool, I downloaded it as a bug deterrent, but the science on that is sketchy, but it's a really cool tool, binaurals, game sound effects and the phone generation and note tool I've used for choirs and tuning instruments, and testing headphones and speakers is brilliant fun. It's generally just great fun to mess about with and nice robust reliable buttons sliders and menus, makes me feel super sciency!

Got this for messing around; but the fact that it allows you to play notes and also displays the frequency is pretty awesome. I went ahead and bought the app remove ads for 3 bux. The price is totally worth it considering all the audio tools they provide and all of the options you can play around with.

Easy to select the number you need and it can play sound with the screen off! And it'll play until you turn it iff or you can set a timer easily. Also, you can have this playing in the background and be playing something else too. Thank you!

This app is great you can pick different frequencies with different wavelengths I use this to set the mood when I want people to leave my house instead of really high picture sound up and everybody starts to get angry and they don't know why you should try it I haven't found a frequency that makes everybody happy

This is not only fun, but a very useful and accessible app. If you like to experiment in scientific ways with electronics and audio, you need a frequency generator and this will give you a very good one at that. A very wide range of frequency is possible, limited only by the audio circuits and speaker in your device. Sine, square, triangle, and sawtooth waveforms are all possible, and can be tuned precisely to any musical note - making this app useful for musique concrete production techniques.

title: Beltone HearPlus
description:
﻿The Beltone HearPlus™ app is compatible with the following hearing aids: 
•	Beltone Legend™
•	Beltone First™
•	Beltone Boost™
•	Beltone Boost Plus™


The Beltone HearPlus app lets you control your hearing aids directly from your mobile device. You can change programs, and make simple or more advanced sound adjustments and save them as favorites. The app helps you learn what you can do and how to do it. It can even help you find your hearing aids if you lose them. 


Notes: Please contact your local Beltone representative for product and feature availability in your market. We recommend that the hearing aids run the latest software version. If in doubt, please contact your hearing care professional.


Beltone HearPlus mobile device compatibility:
Please consult the Beltone app website for up-to-date compatibility information: www.Beltone.com/compatibility 


Use the Beltone HearPlus app to: 
•	Adjust volume settings on your hearing aids
•	Mute your hearing aids
•	Adjust volume of your optionally acquired Beltone streaming accessories
•	Adjust speech focus as well as noise and wind-noise levels with Sound Enhancer (feature availability depends on your hearing aid model and the fitting by your hearing care professional)
•	Change manual and streamer programs
•	Edit and personalize program names 
•	Adjust treble, middle and bass tones to your preferences
•	Save your preferred settings as a Favorite – you can even tag to a location
•	Help locate lost or misplaced hearing aids
•	Tinnitus manager: Adjust sound variation and frequency of the Tinnitus Sound Generator. Select Nature Sounds (feature availability depends on your hearing aid model and the fitting by your hearing care professional)


For more information please visit the support site www.beltone.com/support/apps-support/hearplus-app-support

title: myPhonak
description:
The myPhonak app offers you a remote control functionality which allows you to adjust not only the volume and program but other advanced hearing aid settings such as noise reduction and microphone directionality. You can also have access to the Enhanced Speech Focus* slider, which allows you to change the strength of the new noise canceller. 

* Only available in Phonak Audéo™ P90 (Paradise) devices

The app also enables you to communicate with your HCP and have your hearing aids adjusted remotely and in real-time through Remote Support**. Your HCP can also test your hearing directly through your hearing aids ***. Not only this but your HCP can also send you listening tasks to complete and provide feedback to help you get acclimatized to your hearing aids through Hearing Diary**. Your HCP can also make adjustments to the hearing aids based off the received feedback. Tap Control settings can be configured in the app and other information such as access status like state of the battery charge, wearing time and more. 

** Speak to your HCP to see if this service is offered in your country
*** This doesn’t replace a diagnostic audiological test

The myPhonak app empowers you to:
- adjust the volume, change program or ambient balance while streaming or tinnitus noiser intensity of your hearing aids 
- personalize and customize your hearing programs by making adjustments to the sounds of your hearing aids 
- access the Enhanced Speech Focus where adjustments to the new noise canceller can be made
- save your adjustments in the app so you can use them at any time
- access to status information like battery state of charge and wearing time for rechargeable hearing aids
- configure Auto On when out of charger for rechargeable hearing aids
- change Bluetooth Codec configuration for HFP calls
- configure Tap Control settings for Paradise hearing aids 
- get your hearing aids adjusted by your hearing care professional in real-time and remotely
- see and talk with your hearing care professional during your remote fitting session
- have your hearing tested remotely via your hearing aids 
- experience your new adjustments and give immediate feedback during the remote session
- send feedback and communicate via messages with your hearing care professional about your listening experience 
- complete listening tasks with and without your hearing aids to help acclimatize to your hearing aids

Compatible models: 
- Phonak Audéo™ P (Paradise) ****
- Phonak Audéo™ M (Marvel)
- Phonak Bolero™ M (Marvel)
- Phonak Virto™ M (Marvel)
- Phonak Naida™ M-SP (Marvel)
- Phonak Naida™ Link M (Marvel)
- Phonak Brio™ 4
- Phonak Brio™ 3 R-C *****
- Phonak Audéo™ B-Direct *****

**** Release dates vary by country. Contact your hearing care professional (HCP) for availability.
***** without advanced remote control features.

Device compatibility: 
myPhonak app can be used on Google Mobile Services (GMS) certified AndroidTM devices supporting Bluetooth® 4.2 and Android OS 7.0 or newer. 
If you want to check if your smartphone is compatible, please visit our compatibility checker: https://www.phonak.com/com/en/support/product-support/compatibility.html

The myPhonak app is compatible with Phonak hearing aids with Bluetooth® connectivity. 

Android™ is a trademark of Google, Inc.
Bluetooth® is a trademark of Bluetooth SIG, Inc. and any use of such mark by Sonova AG is under license.

We now support Thai and Indonesian languages

Thank you for using myPhonak!
comments: This app really let's down the experience of otherwise excellent hearing aids. As mentioned by others, with the Bluetooth connection to your phone activated, any interaction with the phone(taking a call,'liking a post on Facebook,plugging in the charger etc etc), causes a default to Autosense option,which kills the settings on your aids,or the custom settings you may have defined for yourself.(This is even after switching off ALL notifications from phone) This is a major fault,and needs fixing.

Slowish to connect but a useful app once it has. Easy to use. Like others Ive found the app quite frequently disconnects which does limit it use. The disconnections are more frequent and are limiting the use of the app. I've installed the updated app and it makes no difference to the disconnections.

Volume doesn't stays consistent when when using the app. Have the hearing aids turned down when a message comes in the volume changes to a painful level. Tried using some of the preset programs, can't edit or save. My Resound app worked much better.

At least once a week, I have to uninstall/reinstall the app because one or the other of the HAs won't connect. It's an irritant because the app controls the sound and pitch. Since I have rechargeable HAs, the app is the ONLY way to control that aspect. I give the HAs a 5star but would rate the app a 3. When it works it's very, very good. But when it doesn't it's horrid.
Close to useless. It keeps disconnecting the Bluetooth and resetting back to Automatic. More trouble than it is worth sadly. Moto Android 1

title: Tinnitus
description:
It is hard to live with tinnitus. Since you are the only one who hears the tinnitus sounds, you may feel alone. There are millions of tinnitus sufferers out there experiencing the same thing. This APP will provide you with strategies that can help you manage your tinnitus.

Tinnitus is the hearing of sound when no external sound is present. While often described as a ringing, it may also sound like a clicking, hiss or roaring. Rarely, unclear voices or music are heard. The sound may be soft or loud, low pitched or high pitched and appear to be coming from one ear or both. Most of the time, it comes on gradually. In some people, the sound causes depression, anxiety or interferes with concentration.

Tinnitus is not a disease but a symptom that can result from a number of underlying causes. One of the most common causes is noise-induced hearing loss. Other causes include: ear infections, disease of the heart or blood vessels, Ménière's disease, brain tumors, emotional stress, exposure to certain medications, a previous head injury, and earwax.

The diagnosis of tinnitus is usually based on the person's description. A number of questionnaires exist that assess how much tinnitus is interfering with a person's life. The diagnosis is commonly assisted with an audiogram and neurological exam. If certain problems are found, medical imaging, such as with MRI, may be performed. Other tests are suitable when tinnitus occurs with the same rhythm as the heartbeat. 

Occasionally, the sound may be heard by someone else using a stethoscope, in which case it is known as objective tinnitus.

Tinnitus can be perceived in one or both ears or in the head. Tinnitus is the description of a noise inside a person’s head in the absence of auditory stimulation. 

The noise can be described in many different ways but the most common description of the tinnitus is a pure tone sound. It is usually described as a ringing noise but, in some patients, it takes the form of a high-pitched whining, electric buzzing, hissing, humming, tinging or whistling sound or as ticking, clicking, roaring, "crickets" or "tree frogs" or "locusts (cicadas)", tunes, songs, beeping, sizzling, sounds that slightly resemble human voices or even a pure steady tone like that heard during a hearing test and, in some cases, pressure changes from the interior ear. 

It has also been described as a "whooshing" sound because of acute muscle spasms, as of wind or waves. Tinnitus can be intermittent or it can be continuous: in the latter case, it can be the cause of great distress. In some individuals, the intensity can be changed by shoulder, head, tongue, jaw or eye movements.

There are two types of tinnitus: subjective tinnitus and objective tinnitus. Tinnitus is usually subjective, meaning that others cannot hear it. Subjective tinnitus has been also called "tinnitus aurium" "nonauditory" and "nonvibratory" tinnitus. Occasionally, tinnitus may be heard by someone else using a stethoscope: in which case, it is objective tinnitus. Objective tinnitus has been called "pseudo-tinnitus" or "vibratory" tinnitus.

Download Tinnitus App It's FREE!!

title: Home Remedies For Tinnitus
description:
If you're being tormented by tinnitus and have sampled just about every treatment available without results, you are not alone. The sad thing is, tinnitus is incredibly difficult to remedy and what works for one person might not exactly work for the other. There's no need to stop trying. Finding a "remedy for tinnitus" is simply a matter of trial and error. If you continue to be persistent, an answer may be just around the corner.

The following home remedies for tinnitus have shown some advantage in helping eliminate symptoms:

Coenzyme Q10: This is an antioxidant important in aiding the immune system and beneficial to blood flow towards the ears.

Ginkgo Biloba: Ginkgo Biloba's effectiveness hasn't been totally established but some tinnitus affected individuals declare that it truly is just the thing that's helped reduce the ringing in their ears. It's important to speak with your family doctor prior to consuming this herb. It can be harmful to certain individuals and there are some experts advising against its use.

Pineapple: Including Pineapple in your diet can help reduce inflammation.

Salt and Glycerin: To lessen ringing in the ears, add a single tsp of salt as well as a single tsp of glycerin into one pint of warm water. Using a sinus spray bottle, spray each nostril and let it drain into the back of your throat. Also spray your throat with exactly the same solution. This should be performed twice a day.

Maidenhair Tree Extract: 20 to 40 mg into each ear. Examine the content label for extra directions.

Exercise: Choose a fun exercise routine and keep active on a regular basis. Remaining physically fit helps to stabilize blood pressure consequently reducing the symptoms of tinnitus.

Improve your tinnitus by boosting your immune system: This could be achieved by including green veggies and fruits in your diet.

Yoga practice is another home remedy for tinnitus. Yoga can help to enhance your GABA levels that could be beneficial in the protection against tinnitus symptoms.

Stay clear of the use of drugs unless of course exclusively prescribed by your doctor. A few drugs can worsen or bring on tinnitus.

Black Cohosh, Bugwart, or Bugbane: This is actually a root which can be beneficial in the protection against the underlying symptoms brought on by tinnitus such as stress, depression and anxiety. It has more of a comforting outcome which improves blood flow.

Mullein Tea: This is helpful in the prevention of throat and ear inflammation. Mullein tea can be especially good for individuals whose tinnitus symptoms seem to be as a result of inflammation.

Vinpocetine: This is actually an extract of the periwinkle plant. Vinpocetine elevates circulation to the inner ear and brain which raises ATP in the brain cells.

If your tinnitus is caused by loud noises, simply wear ear plugs composed of rubber, foam or moldable wax when necessary.

Experts suggest that you should stay clear of processed foods, saturated fats, and sugar. It is also suggested to avoid coffee, tea, sweet foods, and alcohol...

Certain steps are necessary in order to find a solution for tinnitus. Once these steps are followed, there are various effective treatment options that can be utilized. Download Home Remedy for Tinnitus App now!!

title: Natural Remedies For Tinnitus
description:
Tinnitus remedies can be many and varied. Hopefully this guide will help you to get a better understanding of which tinnitus remedies are right for you. Tinnitus can be triggered by conditions such as high blood pressure. In some cases it is linked to anxiety; in others, noise-induced hearing loss. Tinnitus is very common in people of all ages and so it is important to realise that you are not alone. Why some people get tinnitus It is important to remember that tinnitus is a symptom and not a disease. It is an interesting fact that men have problems with tinnitus more often than women. It is worth remembering that Tinnitus also can be worsened by caffeine and other stimulants, so patients should try eliminating use of these substances.

Tinnitus may be considered a significant symptom when its intensity so overrides normal environmental sounds that it invades the consciousness. The patient experiencing tinnitus may describe the sound as ringing, roaring, hissing, whistling, chirping, rustling, clicking or buzzing, or other descriptors. Tinnitus usually produces a shrill, high-pitched, unpleasant tone. In contrast, water and masking sounds are typically soothing. Tinnitus may disappear independently or it can disappear when an underlying problem is successfully treated. In cases of chronic tinnitus for which there is no treatable underlying problem, a variety of tinnitus remdies and suggestions may help to provide substantial relief for persons who suffer from the symptoms. For 1-2% of the general population, this condition causes a considerable amount of distress and interferes seriously with the ability to lead a normal life .It is very difficult to treat and represents, undoubtedly, one of the most difficult therapeutical problems for the otolaryngologist. Tinnitus had been present for at least 6 years in 50% of cases, and most (55%) reported a gradual onset. Tinnitus was described as mildly to extremely annoying by 67%.

Tinnitus may occur with hearing loss. Occasionally, it is a sign of high blood pressure, an allergy, or anemia . Tinnitus can be hard to detect due to the fact that the symptoms can come and go, affect one or both ears and be a high pitched ringing noise or a low dull roaring sound. This makes it harder to diagnose and can leave the sufferer feeling frustrated and helpless. Tinnitus is a common problem, affecting about 17% of the general population around the world (44 million people in the USA). It causes significant suffering in about 4% of the general population (10 million in the USA).

Tinnitus is often most noticeable when you are quiet and trying to get off to sleep. If you play a radio or stereo it can help to mask the tinnitus noise until you drop off to sleep. This disorder can occur in one or both ears, range in pitch from a low roar to a high squeal, and may be continuous or sporadic. Tinnitus is a symptom associated with many forms of hearing loss. It can also be a symptom of other health problems. Tinnitus is the perception of noise in the ear or head, which is generated inside the body rather than coming from outside. Tinnitus is usually only heard by the person with the condition, but in a very few rare cases it can also be heard by other people. Tinnitus can be managed with some lifestyle changes. Avoiding stress, fatigue and loud noise can help.
descriptionHTML:
Tinnitus remedies can be many and varied. Hopefully this guide will help you to get a better understanding of which tinnitus remedies are right for you. Tinnitus can be triggered by conditions such as high blood pressure. In some cases it is linked to anxiety; in others, noise-induced hearing loss. Tinnitus is very common in people of all ages and so it is important to realise that you are not alone. Why some people get tinnitus It is important to remember that tinnitus is a symptom and not a disease. It is an interesting fact that men have problems with tinnitus more often than women. It is worth remembering that Tinnitus also can be worsened by caffeine and other stimulants, so patients should try eliminating use of these substances.

Tinnitus may be considered a significant symptom when its intensity so overrides normal environmental sounds that it invades the consciousness. The patient experiencing tinnitus may describe the sound as ringing, roaring, hissing, whistling, chirping, rustling, clicking or buzzing, or other descriptors. Tinnitus usually produces a shrill, high-pitched, unpleasant tone. In contrast, water and masking sounds are typically soothing. Tinnitus may disappear independently or it can disappear when an underlying problem is successfully treated. In cases of chronic tinnitus for which there is no treatable underlying problem, a variety of tinnitus remdies and suggestions may help to provide substantial relief for persons who suffer from the symptoms. For 1-2% of the general population, this condition causes a considerable amount of distress and interferes seriously with the ability to lead a normal life .It is very difficult to treat and represents, undoubtedly, one of the most difficult therapeutical problems for the otolaryngologist. Tinnitus had been present for at least 6 years in 50% of cases, and most (55%) reported a gradual onset. Tinnitus was described as mildly to extremely annoying by 67%.

Tinnitus may occur with hearing loss. Occasionally, it is a sign of high blood pressure, an allergy, or anemia . Tinnitus can be hard to detect due to the fact that the symptoms can come and go, affect one or both ears and be a high pitched ringing noise or a low dull roaring sound. This makes it harder to diagnose and can leave the sufferer feeling frustrated and helpless. Tinnitus is a common problem, affecting about 17% of the general population around the world (44 million people in the USA). It causes significant suffering in about 4% of the general population (10 million in the USA).

Avoiding stress, fatigue and loud noise can help.

comments: We are LOVING this app! There are so many different settings to choose from, that everyone would find their preferences! Super relaxing and it really helps us fall asleep faster. I played a rain sound on the roof with a little bit of thunder the other night, and my husband asked the next morning, if I heard it rained last night 😄. Thank you for this amazing app!!!🤩

Perfection. I work remote a lot and have to sleep in strange places. Even after long and physically demanding days, I still have a difficult time falling asleep. I looked for this app after 40 minutes of tossing and turning through my allotted 4 hours to sleep. On my first try, I set a timer for 20 minutes and I don't think I last past the first five. I used this app for every night per week and it's still the sure fire away for me to get into deep, solid, restorative sleep. Get this app.

Well I LOVED this app... For the first night. I went to use this the next evening, put my volume up, and there was no sound. I made sure it was playing and even put my volume up to full and nothing was happening, and it isn't my device, it must be the app, because it works fine in every other app or game I have. Idk y it did this, please could you tell me if there is a way to fix this??? Do recommend if it actually works for you.

2nd night of perfect sleep, thanks to this app! The combinations of sounds was exactly what I needed! Also, I use this app in my earphones walking to and from work and it alleviates my anxiety issues! So far I can't recommend it enough!

Waited to write this until I had tried premium for a week and gained access to premium across multiple devices, only paying once. The sounds are lovely, lots of options and the price is literally unbeatable. It's helped my son tremendously with calming down enough to sleep and is a fraction of the cost of the "child oriented" apps for sleep. (Moshi 🥴) The fact that I can have premium access on multiple devices is huge as I use it as well and also for my other child.

title: White Noise Pro
description:
As seen multiple times on the Today Show--Find out why the world is sleeping better with White Noise Pro. Features ambient sounds of the environment to help you relax during the day and sleep great at night.

Do you have trouble going to sleep?  Are you traveling on a plane and need a quick power nap?  Does your newborn baby wake up in the middle of the night?  There are numerous benefits to using White Noise:

•	Helps you sleep by blocking distractions
•	Relaxes and reduces stress
•	Pacifies fussy and crying babies
•	Increases focus while enhancing privacy
•	Soothes headaches and migraines
•	Masks tinnitus (ringing of the ears)

Even when you’re asleep, your brain is constantly scanning and listening for sounds. If it’s too quiet, unwanted noises such as faucet drips or police sirens can interrupt your sleep. White Noise generates sounds over a wide range of frequencies, masking those noise interruptions, so you can not only fall asleep, but stay asleep.

SOUND CATALOG

50 HD sounds are included as part of the application (no downloading required unless you want more) including all the color noises (brown, white, pink, etc), mechanical sounds like box fan or air conditioner, light to heavy rains, rushing water sounds, beach and ocean waves, and so much more.  For the entire list of sounds please visit our website.  No streaming is required for playback.

APPLICATION FEATURES
•	50+ HD full stereo sounds that are exclusive to White Noise Pro
•       Generate binaural beats, custom color noises, and tones using the pro generator tools included with White Noise Pro
•	Download additional sounds for free with the White Noise Market app or website:  https://whitenoisemarket.com
•       Record, loop, and share new sounds with total ease
•	Background audio support so you can use other apps while listening
•       App Widget and Chromecast TV support for audio control and playback.  (Note: Chromecast audio devices require using the Google Home app)
•	Create new soundscapes by mixing multiple noises together with support for adjusting volume, balance, pitch, and variance of each individual sound in the mix.
•	Full screen digital clock with multiple colors and brightness controls makes it the perfect companion for any nightstand
•	Advanced alarm and timer system that slowly fades audio in and out so you awake naturally feeling more refreshed.  Supports music alarms too with Android 5.0 devices.
•	Create a playlist of your favorite sounds and mixes to enjoy different ambiences throughout the day
•	On-screen media and volume controls with swipe gesture support for quickly navigating sound collection
•	Advanced Settings let you prevent interruptions such as notifications, tweak buffer size for optimal playback, adjust sound volume, balance, pitch, custom alarm snooze times, and more.  All the pro tools and settings you need for better sleep.
•	Designed to work on all Android-based phones and tablets
•	No Advertising

PRESS REVIEWS

TODAY SHOW:
"Savannah's Secret to a better night's sleep."

DR. OZ SHOW: 13 Miracles of 2013
"Revolutionary Sound App!”

AMAZING ANDROID APPS - Book by Daniel A. Begun
"White Noise can instantly transform a chaotic environment into a calm oasis."

THE WASHINGTON POST: Smartphone Puts Newborn to Sleep 
"For the next four months, the infant slept with his father's phone in his crib and White Noise tuned to 'air conditioner."

HEALTH MAGAZINE: "Help you turn off your brain, fall asleep faster, and get the rest you desperately need"

PERMISSIONS EXPLAINED:

WAKE_LOCK / DISABLE_KEYGUARD: Alarms unlock and wake the device
WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE: Importing and exporting sounds require external storage
MICROPHONE: Only used to create and loop new recordings
CAMERA: Only used to assign photos to your recordings
LOCATION: Only used to assign location to new recordings

Visit our website at https://www.tmsoft.com/white-noise/ for additional details.

comments: Love this, worth every penny. Dinged one star for the companion market app being overloaded with ads and not downloading sounds that are part of mixes automatically when the mix is downloaded. The NASA stuff is beyond cool.
Amazing. Been 4 years now that I've used this every night to help me sleep. I can't imagine sleeping without the gentle sounds of rain and distant thunder
Strange behavior on latest build - the app starts all by itself! Otherwise, smooth playing sounds with the ability to mix!

Best noise app I've used. Great sound selection and quality. For me, the killer feature is the balance control, bc I have one ear that is much better than the other. I wish more apps had this. Also has good geeky controls over battery saver, multithreading, buffer, etc. Even if you are not a semi-deaf audio nerd like me, it's a great app overall. Well worth the cost of Pro to me. 😍
Best app for white noise and soothing sounds.

title: BeyondTinnitus
description:
First in the World:
Our application is the first in the world to combine the power of sound therapy with cognitive behavioral therapy in an online platform to provide tinnitus relief to people all over the world.

Minimal Design:
We focus on reducing the loudness and annoyance of the tinnitus you're experiencing through personalized sound and behavioral therapy. We have combined the knowledge from neuroscience, audiology, psychology, and integrative health to build a platform to help provide tinnitus relief.

First English CBT:
We adapt to your need as your tinnitus progress, providing a comprehensive solution to battle tinnitus. Our web-based cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) is the first in the United States and United Kingdom to provide therapy directed towards helping tinnitus patients.

Tinnitus Pitch Matching:
Our application can accurately match your tinnitus. Then based on protocols developed at the University of California provide you with scientifically-proven harmonic sound therapy to provide you relief.

Personalized Sound Therapy:
Unlike using a generic white noise or sound from hearing aids, the sound therapy provided by our application helps direct the sound to the area of the brain most responsible for your tinnitus. In a head-to-head study of our harmonic sound therapy vs. white noise, we found that the loudness and annoyance of tinnitus decreased with our harmonic sound therapy compared to no improvement in loudness or annoyance with white noise.

Music Therapy:
Listen to your own songs on Apple Music, Spotify, or Google Play Music without any interruptions while listening to the harmonic sound therapy in the background working to reduce your tinnitus.

Notice: This is not the full version of the app.

title: Natural Remedies for Tinnitus
description:
Natural Remedies for Tinnitus | Tinnitus is the term that describes a condition that makes it seem as if there is a sound originating in the ears even when there are no apparent external noises. Tinnitus is not actually a disease but is a symptom of some other underlying condition.

Many health care professionals consider tinnitus to be a blessing in disguise. When tinnitus is present it can help detect an underlying disease or infection before it becomes aggravated. Once the cause is discovered the treatments are simple.

There are several different treatment options for tinnitus because of the various reasons for ringing in the ears. However, care should be used when treating tinnitus because some treatments can aggravate the conditions. For this reason, the best solutions are often home remedies for tinnitus that effectively control the ringing in the ears. Following you will find some of the common tinnitus home remedies

One of the very best tinnitus home remedies is your diet. Eat a fairly simple diet with few additional spices added to it. Work on reducing your consumption of saturated fats, salt, and sugar. Additionally, you should avoid drinking coffee and tea as this will worsen the pain.

Eat plenty of fresh fruits and green vegetables. This will reduce your suffering by improving your immune system. You can try chewing dry fruit to improve the blood circulation, which will go a long way toward curing tinnitus.

With daily exercise, you will stay mentally and physically fit. This will help reduce the risk of tinnitus occurring because it helps regulate your blood. Take only drugs that have been prescribed by your doctor as there are some drugs that tend to aggravate tinnitus.

When you go to bed at night, turn a radio on but detune it and place it near you as you sleep to help neutralize the inner noise. This is a very effective home remedy for tinnitus.

Loud noises are known to aggravate tinnitus so its best to avoid load noises such as traffic and those crowded public places. If these situations cannot be avoided, use ear plugs to control the decibel level of the noise that does enter your ears.

These are some very effective tinnitus home remedies that may help you quickly overcome the ringing noise in your ears without causing any unwanted side effects

In addition to these home remedies to treat tinnitus, there is another powerful technique that is being used today. This technique is used to control the ringing in the ears and is very effective. Any individual that suffers from tinnitus should apply this technique 40-50 times a day.

This technique is called ear drumming. To apply the method, both ears must be closed, using the palm of the hand with the fingers clasped behind the skull. Next, the index finger is placed over the middle finger. The index finger is then forced to slide over the middle finger, landing on the bottom of the skull, creating a drumming sound. This is a very effective tinnitus home remedy.

Next, the index finger is placed over the middle finger. The index finger is then forced to slide over the middle finger, landing on the bottom of the skull, creating a drumming sound. This is a very effective tinnitus home remedy.
summary: Learn How To Use Natural Home Remedies For Tinnitus To Cure The Condition

title: Relax and Sleep
description:
Already used by more than 5 million people around the globe to aid with their meditation, tinnitus, sleep, mindfulness, therapy, newborn baby, pregnancy, stress, concentration, work...

Choose from more than 50 ambient sounds, including white noise, thunder, rain, the ocean, lightning, water, birds, bugs, instruments, mechanical and nature noises.

Combine multiple sounds and tune their individual volume to create your own unique mix.

Set timers, store presets or combine both to create your own unique wake-up alarm.

Use all available sounds for FREE, no extra purchases needed, no ads.

Need more advanced features or need to store more than 4 timers and presets?

title: White Noise - Relaxing sounds for sleeping
description:
Sleep well with white noise. Over 35 high quality natural and artificial sounds. All free. No audible loop.

Ideal for relaxing, sleeping, meditation, concentration, or if you have problems with tinnitus (ear ringing).

White noise has beneficial effects on the body and mind because, covering the noise of the external environment, promotes relaxation and concentration.

You can set the timer and put your app in background or turn off the screen. At the end of the time, the sound fades gently and the application closes by itself. So you do not have to worry about closing the app if you fall asleep.

Do you have trouble going to sleep? White noise helps you to sleep by blocking distractions. Now you can asleep faster and sleep better!
You can say goodbye to your insomnia! Improve your life!

Use it after a stressful day to regain your inner peace. Go into your oasis of calm with "relax white noise".


*** Main features of "relax white noise" ***

- 35+ perfectly looped sounds
- timer system that slowly fades audio out
- auto-pause sounds on incoming call
- volume controls
- usage in the background and with other apps
- no streaming is required for playback (no data connection required)
- quick menu of the sounds and setting of favorite sound (in the Premium version)


*** List of the relaxing sounds ***

Natural relaxing sounds

- Cicadas
- Creek
- Fireplace
- Fountain
- Heavy rain
- Night
- Ocean
- Rain
- Snow
- Waterfall
- Wind

Artificial relaxing sounds

- Air conditioner
- Airplane
- Boiling pot
- Car
- Computer fan
- Dishwasher
- Diver
- Fan
- Fridge
- Hairdryer
- Helicopter
- Hydromassage
- Keyboard
- Shower
- Space Shuttle
- Sprinkler
- Submarine
- Train
- Truck engine
- Vacuum cleaner
- Washing machine
- Wipers
- Oscillating fan


*** Usage notes of the "relax white noise" ***

For a better experience, I recommend you the use of headphones or earphones to listen the relaxing sounds.
You can use the app in background and with other apps.
Put the timer to go to sleep and the app closes by itself.


*** Notes on permissions ***

- Device ID & call information (read phone status and identity)
Used to stop sound on incoming call and to play again at the end of call.

- In-app purchases
Used in the purchase of the premium version.

- Full network access and view network connections
Used to verify the purchases and show ads.

comments: First I must say, last nt was the first time I downloaded this app and used it. THANK THE LORD it did NOT cut off or decrease in the volume button. There are some pretty awesome sounds on here that I have heard nowhere else !! Ex: Dishwasher, computer fan, sprinkler, helicopter blades spinning, washing machine, besides your normal sounds such as heavy rain, creek, wind, ocean, train, and oscillating fan (My Favorite) and others to pick from. The pics with each are so realistic!! TRY IT OUT!!

I just opened this "WHITE NOISE" app and it's great- it's a combination of some of the others with more thrown in~ common every day sounds~ I always know when I open a MIKDROID app that I'm going to be happy with it because they are all set up so beautifully ~ I particularly like the train one as I've always found the sound of trains beckons to the past when life was simpler

Have not been using this app very long, but it does everything I want, with no problems. It even plays in the background when I want to do other things on my tablet. It also has a timer so I can have it turn after I'm asleep. Try it, I think you'll like it. Happy sleeping!

Fun to scroll through the sounds with your eyes closed and try to guess what each is. There are some really great relaxing sounds on here. I got stuck on oscillating fan and might be listening to that at night for some time.

I like the app, especially the airplane sound, for sleeping. The only problem for me is that sometimes it just turns off by itself. Usually I have no problem, but recently it has been happening periodically.

title: StopTinnitus Pro
description:
StopTinnitus is designed to evaluate your tinnitus and cancel the noise generated by Tinnitus. 
Use StopTinnitus to find the sounds that provide the most tinnitus relief for you. Once you find cancellation sound, you can save them to provide immediate access to tinnitus relief.
Based on sound therapy , StopTinnitus provides a flexible and easy to use interface for tone cancellation.
It works as follows - 

Step 1 : Find Frequency -
Narrow down on your tinnitus tone/frequency. The wizard runs in two steps
2.1) Find approximate frequency.
2.2) Fine tune in a 1KHz band.
Step 2 : Tone cancellation -
This step helps to further fine tune the frequency and also find the phase shift parameter for cancellation.

Step 3 : Save Tone -
Save cancelled tone by adding a name and an optional note for easier identification.

Step 4: On saved tone page, confirm phase reversal with TFA mode overlying Frequency with selected tone and manually shifting phase of control tone.

Step 5: Use audio device, i.e. earbuds, blue tooth audio devices, headsets, speakers etc. to to deliver Tinnitus Noise cancelling relief.

(because of the complexity and variations of Tinnitus, may not work for all users)

recentChanges:
This update contains following features -
a. Tone Finder Assist(TFA) -
TFA helps you to identify how tone cancellation works on your Tinnitus frequency. You can check it while playing your saved tone.
b. Stereo/ Mono tone support
User can find frequencies separately for left and right ear, perform cancellation on each ear and save cancelled tone. Tone player can play & update cancellation tone separately for both ears.
comments: The app doesn't have easy manual control to find your tinnitus pitch...only an auto slider which i found hard to control. The suggested tinnitus relief tone really didn't work for me. At $12, it is too expensive for what it is. Bonus that it is stereo for independent ear tones
Doesn't work on Samsung Galaxy Grand Duos

title: Beltone HearMax
description:
﻿The Beltone HearMax™ app is compatible with the following hearing aids: 
•	Beltone Imagine™
•	Beltone Amaze™
•	Beltone Trust™ 
•	Beltone Boost Max™ 
•	Beltone Boost Ultra™


The Beltone HearMax app lets you control your hearing aids directly from your mobile device. You can change programs, and make simple or more advanced sound adjustments and save them as favorites. The app helps you learn what you can do and how to do it. It can even help you find your hearing aids if you lose them. Last, but not least, you can have your hearing care professional update your hearing aid programs and send you new hearing aid software without taking a trip to the clinic.


Notes: Please contact your local Beltone representative for product and feature availability in your market. We recommend that the hearing aids run the latest software version. If in doubt, please contact your hearing care professional.


Beltone HearMax mobile device compatibility:
Please consult the Beltone app website for up-to-date compatibility information: www.beltone.com/compatibility


Use the Beltone HearMax app to: 
•	Connect your Beltone Amaze hearing aids to compatible Android devices for direct audio streaming
•	Enjoy Beltone Remote Care: Request help with your hearing aid settings from your hearing care professional and receive new settings and software updates. 


And use these direct control and personalization options:
•	Adjust volume settings on your hearing aids
•	Mute your hearing aids
•	Adjust volume of your Beltone streaming accessories
•	Adjust speech focus as well as noise and wind-noise levels with Sound Enhancer (feature availability depends on your hearing aid model and the fitting by your hearing care professional) 
•	Change manual and streamer programs
•	Edit and personalize program names 
•	Adjust treble, middle and bass tones to your preferences
•	Save your preferred settings as a Favorite – you can even tag to a location
•	Monitor the battery status of your rechargeable hearing aids
•	Help locate lost or misplaced hearing aids
•	Tinnitus manager: Adjust sound variation and frequency of the Tinnitus Breaker Pro. Select Nature Sounds (feature availability depends on your hearing aid model and the fitting by your hearing care professional)


For more information please visit www.beltone.com/hearmax or the support site www.beltone.com/support/apps-support/hearmax-app-support

comments: My husband has new aids less then a year old . When we tried to connect to the app, we kept getting the message aids were in compatible with app. It also said it would direct us back to Google so we could download the corresponding for his aids and it never did. Just kept trying to connect. People spend lots for your aids, come on Beltone at least help us out with decent apps.
I was connected for a couple of days now I cannotget past the demo stage. This app is garbage
I get to the you're installed and it freezes my phone . Stupid app

If you need to use HearMax I recommend that you do NOT get an Android 10 phone (or one that is likely to be upgraded to 10.) The Direct Audio Streaming feature is awful and there is no way to turn if off except to turn off your phone's Bluetooth or uninstall HearMax. If I want to stream music to a Bluetooth speaker or to use Android Auto, for example, it interferes; it basically hijacks the Bluetooth for its own use. The sound quality of DAS on HearMax is horrible.
Same issue as everyone else. It does not pair up with android devices since the last update (tried on Samsung, Huawei and LG). It worked fine on the previous update...please restore that version

title: Calm Ocean Waves Sounds: Relax Music, White Noise
description:
Calm Ocean sounds helps for sleep with sleep sounds of Ocean which creates a white noise and it's prove scientifically to help take control of your sleep and relieve stress, insomnia, tinnitus. Use nature sounds, white noise, relax melodies and soothing sounds in this app. Gain a high-quality sleep with ocean waves sounds...!

This app have sounds of the sea, the sounds played in this way are also known as white noise.
White noise has take beneficial effects on the body and mind because covering the noise of the external environment, promotes relaxation and  deep concentration.

comments: I found a sound that I really like. However the app is glitchy. I set the timer for 10 hours so it will run all night, but it randomly stops throughout the night and has to be restarted. I would rate this app much higher if it actually stayed on. Even if I set the timer, it shuts down in less than a minute. It's too bad. I love the soothing sounds.

title: Sleep sounds free. Relax music, white noise.
description:
Play our carefully selected soothing sounds. Calm your mind brings for you sleep sounds, relaxing music, sleep music, Meditation. Relax and sleep with 10+ sleep sounds scientifically proven to help take control of your sleep and relieve stress, insomnia, tinnitus. Use nature sounds, white noise, relax melodies and soothing sounds to create your own mixes.

Our free application contains the following sounds:

♫ Music Paradise.
♫ Waterfall Music with Nature Sounds.
♫ Sleep Music Piano and Acoustic Guitar.
♫ Zen Music and Calming Cascade Sound.
♫ Rain Sound and Rainforest Animals Sound - Relaxing Sleep.
♫  Nature Sounds to Sleep and Meditation - Music for Insomnia.
♫ Relaxing Crackling and River Forest Sound.


Close your eyes, put on the headphones and choose one of the natural sounds and relax or sleep better.

Our app has the following features:

- Work offline. You don’t need internet connection.
- Absolutely free.
- You could remove ads for extra money.
- High quality nature sounds.
- Amazing HD background pictures.
- Control playback from the lock screen or notifications menu.
- This has a sleep timer. Only set the timer for 30 minutes and you always asleep before the timer goes off.
- Free for download mp3 files.
- Individual volume control
- It’s very relaxing!

This app is for those who:

✎ Suffering from terrible insomnia.
✎ Want sleep better.
✎ Doing yoga exercises and meditation.
✎ Learn to breath correctly.
✎ Have Tinnitus
✎ Want to get rid of stress and anxiety.
✎ Improve concentration.

Noise isn't always the chatty colleague in your open-plan office, or the sound of your tinnitus when you go to sleep. Though the word 'noise' has acquired a negative connotation, it can be beautiful, such as the sound of the ocean, the rain, or a field in the summer.

The idea behind an online background noise machine like this website, is to make use of the noises you like to mask the noises you dislike. The concept is simple, works extremely well, and does not require expensive equipment, such as active noise cancelling headphones.

title: Brown Noise, Pink Noise and White Noise.
description:
Brown Noise or red noise and also called as brownian noise, is relaxing and healing sound. The qualities of the brown noise are great for relax and falling asleep.
Benefits of brown noise:
• Relaxation or meditation.
• Helps your baby to relax, stop crying, sleep better and faster.
• Reduces stress.
• Improved focus.
• Mindfulness background sound.
• Increased reading comprehension.
• Help sleep improvement.
• Stay asleep with no external interruptions.

Pink noise is like white noise, but instead of having equal power across frequencies, pink noise comes out louder and more powerful at the lower frequencies. To your ears, the sound is deeper and softer than white noise.
Benefits of pink noise:
• Eliminating background sounds.
• Help Alleviate headaches.
• More restful sleep or naps.
• Improvement in deep sleep.
• Soothed babies and young children.
• Better sleep in general.

White noise is a special type of sound signal which is used to mask background sounds. When used to promote healthy sleep, white noise helps to drown out sounds which might otherwise prevent you from either falling asleep or waking up whilst asleep.
Benefits of white noise:
• Sound masking and cancellation.
• Improved concentration.
• Sleep promotion.
• Masks tinnitus or reduces ear ringing.
• Relieves sleeping disorder.
• Good for attention.
• Improves concentration by preventing outside disturbances.

More therapeutic noises included:
• Fan sound (white noise).
• Hair dryer (white noise).
• Truck engine (pink noise).
• Train (monotonous noise).
• Waterfall (natural brown noise).
• Rain (natural pink noise).

Features of the app:
• High quality stereo sound.
• Timer to set the time of the session or infinite playback.
• Lightweight and works offline.
• Volume control.
• Beautifully designed, with 3D effects.
• Set a starting sound, so the app starts playing that sound when open.

recentChanges: New sound: Tibetan Bowl.
comments: Honestly the sounds are great and is easy to use. I don't mind ads in free aps but the reality is that this is supposed to be an app to help you relax, sleep, meditate... But then video/graphic ads come on with incredibly annoying sounds or music. Defeats the entire purpose, and ruins an otherwise great app

Had an ad come on while playing the brown noise, kinda ruined it as I use the noise for meditation. I closed the app and the sound continued. I had to restart my phone to get it to stop. Ads during the use of the sounds makes the whole thing pointless. It would ruin it for mindfulness or trying to sleep because of tinnitus etc.

Best app out there, good for quiet mind and I would recommend to anyone there are no ads at all and if people do complain about ads it solution is actually very simple don't have it on at the same time as the Internet so I thank the developers who made this

I like the brown noise the best. 2 stars because the app will randomly shut off for no reason, and then automatically revert to white noise. And you can't "swipe" over to go through the sounds, you have to pay for that now which is total bs. I have to uninstall and reinstall all the time because it will get bogged down with ads, or the looped sound gets really choppy.

I downloaded this app in its free version because it had white, pink, and brown noise. I prefer the brown noise over the others for sleeping and this didn't disappoint. A very nice feature is exiting the application and the option for the app to keep running. There are shortcuts in the pulldown to stop the sound or close the app. The paid version removed all ads. Overall, a simple but highly useful and effective application.

title: Relax Melodies: Sleep Sounds
description:
Can’t sleep at night?  Relax Melodies is designed to be the most efficient Sleep-Aid App  to make you fall asleep quickly and wake up refreshed. Relax, take a deep breath and join us on a restful journey to sleep!

Enjoy a large variety of Nature Sounds, White Noise, Guided Meditations, Bedtime Stories, Brainwaves, Body-Mind Exercises and Breathing Techniques that you can mix and combine to create your very own Bedtime Experience. We collaborate with Sleep Experts to make sure that our content and techniques will help you overcome Insomnia, Tinnitus, Night-Time Anxiety and lower your Everyday Stress.

You’ll fall back in love with sleep by joining our community of 50 million happy sleepers we help calm, fall asleep, and relax every night. Sweet dreams!

FEATURING:
Large sound library
Guided Meditation Programs & Sleep meditations
Bedtime Stories for everyone
Sleep Moves with or without your pillow
Breathing techniques
And more!

People love Relax Melodies:
Editors’ choice on Google Play
**Voted best Health and Fitness app** — MUX 2018
** It’s like a GPS directing you how to fall asleep ** — The Guardian
**Best app for insomnia** — Healthline


🌖Sleep Sounds, Brainwaves, & White Noises:
Explore our selection of over 200 soothing sounds, music, beats, and tones designed specially by our in-house experts to lull you to sleep. Mix them together to create your very own soundscapes:

Library includes :
* Nature sounds: wind, rustling leaves, birds, crackling fire
* White noise: hair dryer, airplane, dryer, vacuum, fan noise
* Water sounds: rainstorm, ocean, slow waves, lapping water
* Meditation music: voices, instruments, ambient melodies
* Isochronic Brainwaves: 2.5Hz, 4Hz, 5Hz, 8Hz, 10Hz, 20Hz
* Binaural Beats: 2.5Hz, 4Hz, 5Hz, 8Hz, 10Hz, 20Hz…

🌖Guided Meditation Programs & Sleep Meditations:
Add a sleep meditation to your soundscape to quiet your mind and guide you to a deep slumber. Choose over 160 meditations created especially to help you relax and drift to sleep.

Themes included :
* Restful sleep
* Falling Back Asleep
* Visualization
* Gratitude
* Tinnitus relief
* Stress and Anxiety relief
* Deep sleep
* Napping
* The realms of Dreams...

🌖Bedtime Stories
Embark on a journey with our Bedtime Stories narrated with soothing voices and written specially to send you to dreamland.

Themes included :
* Fairytale
* Mystery
* Sci-fi
* Fantasy
* Non-fiction


🌖SleepMoves: Move. Breathe. Sleep
Experience our SleepMoves, a series of body-mind exercises and relaxation techniques developed in collaboration with sleep professionals. Let yourself be guided through gentle movements easing you into a deep sleep.


* Mini: to help you unwind quickly
* Together: Enjoy unwinding as a couple with this relaxation routine
* Travel: Overcome jet-lag and homesickness
* Cooldown: Drain excess energy
* Harmony: Find your balance and recenter yourself
		

🌖Breathing Techniques: Sound Breathing for Day and Night
Achieve specific goals such as reducing your anxiety or clearing your mind with our Sound Breathings. Blending breathing exercises with soothing sounds, they will melt your worries away!

Topics included :
* Take a Break
* De-Stress
* Clear your mind
* Fall asleep

Also featuring:
Bedtime reminder: Set one every night to get more restful sleep
Timer: Stop the application after a set amount of time
And more!

...

comments: Deeper sleep than with any other sounds. We've used a box fan in our room for years to help us sleep. I downloaded this app and used it on a vacation when we didn't have room to pack the huge box fan. Using a combination of white, brown, and other noises, including the Dreams frequency, we slept deeper than we could remember ever having slept before. Now we use this all the time and consistently wake up feeling nicely rested. The paid version is so worth it because of the dream frequency.

I used to use this back when it was just a webpage, and it's helped so much with my anxiety and night terrors. This kind of app is deeply helpful for people like me. I love it, it's incredible, but I'm SO disappointed at the fact that premium is a SUBSCRIPTION and the outrageous price for it. If there was an option to purchase a certain package, like specific sounds, I'd have rated this the 5 stars it should have. I don't need new content every week. Unfortunately, it gets a 3.

Wonderful! I used this a long while ago and decided to come back to it. I've been using the isochronic sounds for a while and they've actually helped! But i hear a LOT of static when i use them. I'm not sure if its an app problem or maybe phones arent meant to run such a low tone but its gotten a bit worse. Other than that the sounds are all perfect and just what i need with the free version.

It's a lifesaver. You don't need cell service or wifi to use it, so no matter where you are you can have a waterfall, a campfire, and some peaceful music (or whatever noises you want) for free. It uses very little battery as well and will play in the background if you're using other apps. There are some noises you have to upgrade for, but for the most part, it's free, loud, and doesn't have audible looping. Thank goodness for this app.

I really like the 'eternity' sound but every time I turn it on, there's this static noise that pops up. Its very distracting. I thought it might be my phone but I turned on the same music on YouTube and Spotify and there was no static, so it's definitely the app. I would like to continue using it on the app because it plays on and on but I don't want the static noise.

title: myNoise
description:
The idea behind a noise machine, is to make use of the noises you like to mask the noises you dislike. The concept is simple, works extremely well, and does not require expensive equipment, such as active noise cancelling headphones.

Background noises can be used in a variety of ways throughout your daily lives, and by all audiences. They can not only help you focus while working in a noisy environment, or help to settle your anxiety, but they are also useful in cases of insomnia or tinnitus. Fortunately, you don't need a specific reason to start listening to our noise generators! These are all sonic marvels that you will simply enjoy listening to; candy for your ears!

myNoise is free, with White Noise, Rain Noise, Binaural Beats, Spring Walk, Temple Bells and Warp Speed, the white noise machine for Sci-Fi fans!

Terms of use: these sound generators are provided for personal/private use only. myNoise audio stems are subject to copyright and shall not be used in any other context without permission.

comments: Disappointing experience with the app that doesn't live up to the web version. Glad it has my favorite sounds form the site to access, but the interface is unintuitive, esp for setting presets etc (should be a save icon or something to make it clearer). Animation isn't subtle in any of the presets - sliders go all the way down / up even in "zen" mode. App randomly pauses sometimes. Timer feature makes no sense, "In/At" ?? Would expect time out, and fade out speed maybe. Would love to see updates

I paid the full sum to get all the sounds but for some reason the timer on the app doesn't work for me anymore. I had set it to 1 hour and 25 minutes but 7 hours later it was still running and the battery of my phone was drained. I'm also disappointed by the lack of updates on the sounds, it seemed so much nicer on the site.

Been a big fan of mynoise online. I donate when I can because the different combinations of generators are perfect for studying, relaxing, just having some sound when you're cleaning or doing anything else. But I will echo other reviewers. The android app does feel neglected. While there's a lot of grear functionality, the sound quality's not the best. There's a lot of static, and sometimes it just stops for long enough for me to unlock my phone and then starts up again. Otherwise works fine

Highly adjustable white noise generator with variations all free. However, there is a serious bug when used for sleeping or if you're away from the phone because it would simply stop or shut off for no apparent reason about 10% of the time. This means instead of waking up to my alarm, I wake up to the noise that this app was supposed to block out. I can only recommend this if you're using it while awake and near the phone to turn it back on when this happens. Other bugs include sometimes needing to restart the app in order for it to play.

Anti-climactic. After all the hype on the website, I expected to at least hear some sound. I have my device plugged into a rather large bluetooth speaker, which gets way too loud when I play music, and I can just barely hear mynoise. Don't waste your time.

title: Tinnitus Tips
description:
Envision a consistent ringing, humming or shrieking in your ear, 24 hours every day. It is called tinnitus. You never get a break. It is dependably there.

No one else however you can hear the commotion since it doesn't originate from any outside source.

In spite of the fact that you are the main individual who can hear the clamor it's anything but a consequence of your creative energy.

Tinnitus Remedies
Signs and Symptoms of Tinnitus
Clear Tinnitus Noise
Ginkgo Biloba for Tinnitus
No Cure For Tinnitus?
End Tinnitus
Can Hypnosis Really Cure Tinnitus
Tinnitus Relief
Finding Tinnitus Help
10 Ways To Stop Tinnitus


Tinnitus can change a considerable measure between people; in this manner you can discover a wide range of sorts of tinnitus.

Tinnitus differs extensively in power and sort. A few people depict tinnitus as high-recurrence shrieking sounds while others see tinnitus as a humming commotion or a sound like spread sizzling in a skillet.

Be that as it may, some experience, rather, a pounding sound in indistinguishable cadence from their pulse. This is called pulsatile tinnitus.

What causes tinnitus? The reasons for tinnitus may fluctuate. Be that as it may, the most widely recognized reason for tinnitus is introduction to commotion. However, tinnitus may likewise be cause by ailments, stress and head wounds

No one knows what number of experiences tinnitus. All of us encounter tinnitus briefly; maybe for a couple of hours after a show or whatever other event where our ears are subjected to commotion.

However, for some tinnitus winds up constant as well as increments. The greater part of individuals who experience the ill effects of tinnitus think that its exceptionally exasperating and awkward.

Numerous who endure tinnitus encounter symptoms of their tinnitus. This may incorporate mental, physical and social issues. Some additionally encounter pressure, weariness, enthusiastic issues and discouragement.

Many offer a fix or a treatment for tinnitus and some offer items against tinnitus, however so far there are no logical demonstrated treatment or solution for tinnitus.

In any case, extraordinary composes adapting systems may assist individuals with living with their tinnitus.

Tinnitus is normal in individuals beyond 40 years old, yet is winding up progressively pervasive in more youthful individuals, also, as a result of expanded day by day clamor levels, including those caused by the unreasonable utilization of MP3s, iPods and other individual stereos.

Numerous individuals who experience the ill effects of tinnitus may likewise experience the ill effects of hearing misfortune. Despite the fact that tinnitus is more typical among individuals who experience the ill effects of hearing misfortune, anybody can experience the ill effects of tinnitus. It is likewise conceivable to experience the ill effects of real hearing misfortune without contracting tinnitus by any means.

In the event that you encounter both tinnitus and hearing misfortune and you start to utilize listening devices, you will locate that portable hearing assistants may both enhance hearing and diminish the bothering of tinnitus.

When you first experience tinnitus, you may normally be stressed and extremely mindful of this new stable.

We continually screen our bodies and on the off chance that anything transforms, we wind up mindful of the progressions.

Hearing tinnitus out of the blue can be very startling in the event that you think it implies that something isn't right with you, or that it may change your life. It's another sensation and you have to give yourself an opportunity to adjust.

description:
Sound Oasis® is the world leader in sound therapy systems. We take relaxation and sleep therapy seriously and hope that this White Noise app helps you.

This app provides a sample of just a few of our professionally recorded and edited soundscapes that have been carefully selected to help you to escape, relax, sleep and rejuvenate your body and your mind, a fully functional playback timer, and soft off volume management.

How Does This APP Work?

The sounds in this app can be an effective tool to help you relax and fall asleep using sound therapy. Nature sounds create a familiar, highly effective way to relax, block out unwanted sounds and create a soothing sound environment. These white noise focused sound tracks are carefully designed so that you experience our world famous sounds uninterrupted for the best sleep experience possible.

3 INCLUDED SPECIALTY SOUNDS

- White Noise
- Pink Noise
- Rain on a Tent


SESSION TIMER

- 5 to 120 minute session timer with continuous therapy option.

- Full volume control with soft off volume management.

title: ReSound Smart
description:
﻿The ReSound Smart™ app is compatible with the following hearing aids: 
•	ReSound LiNX2™
•	ReSound LiNX™
•	ReSound LiNX TS™
•	ReSound ENZO2™
•	ReSound ENZO™
•	ReSound UpSmart™


The ReSound Smart app lets you control your hearing aids directly from your mobile device. You can change programs, and make simple or more advanced sound adjustments and save them as favorites. The app helps you learn what you can do and how to do it. It can even help you find your hearing aids if you lose them. 


Notes: Please contact your local ReSound representative for product and feature availability in your market. We recommend that the hearing aids run the latest software version. If in doubt, please contact your hearing care professional.


ReSound Smart mobile device compatibility:
Please consult the ReSound app website for up-to-date compatibility information: www.resound.com/compatibility 


Use the ReSound Smart app to: 
•	Adjust volume settings on your hearing aids
•	Mute your hearing aids
•	Adjust volume of your optionally acquired ReSound streaming accessories
•	Adjust speech focus as well as noise and wind-noise levels with Sound Enhancer (feature availability depends on your hearing aid model and the fitting by your hearing care professional) 
•	Change manual and streamer programs
•	Edit and personalize program names 
•	Adjust treble, middle and bass tones to your preferences
•	Save your preferred settings as a Favorite – you can even tag to a location
•	Help locate lost or misplaced hearing aids
•	Tinnitus manager: Adjust sound variation and frequency of the Tinnitus Sound Generator. Select Nature Sounds (feature availability depends on your hearing aid model and the fitting by your hearing care professional)


For more information please visit the support website www.resound.com/help/apps/smart

recentChanges: ﻿The update includes improvements to stability and connectivity.
comments: I have only one working hearing aid because, I no longer wear the left side hearing aid. Because of this the app needs both aids to be able to connect to the right side aid. Note: I wear a cochlear processor for the left ear that is compatible with my ReSound phone clip but not the ReSound Smart App.
Used to work fine. Now sticks on demo. Won't pair with my hearing aids. Update...Resound offered advise, app must have been improved, things work as they are supposed to.
Had to install on my wife's phone for some reason this will not install on a new one plus phone. Would be nice if they would updated for the new phones.

Every product can have a problem - the measure of a company is how they respond. I noted a problem earlier - since then the team in ReSound have been excellent and attentive. They stayed with me and helped until a solution was found - was down to my Bluetooth connection. Great product, great app and great support. Recommended.

It can be a little touchy about loosing connection with on or both hearing aids but all in all a great app. I wish they would add ability to gear phone calls through your hearing devices tho. That's kind of the point isnt it?

title: How to Prevent Tinnitus
description: Tinnitus is a disorder that gives people the sensation of noise or ringing in the ears. It is a symptom of an underlying condition such as hearing loss or another ear injury and can be associated with vertigo and dizziness. Tinnitus is a common problem that affects about 20% of the population. Although often bothersome, tinnitus is not normally the sign of a serious problem. By limiting exposure to loud noises and caring for your health, you can prevent tinnitus.

title: Ear Therapy
description:
Paid version of application.  

Features NO pesky banner ads, & much MORE detail on the images. Ear stars are now numbered.  Refer to the bottom of the image for associated names of the auricular points.

Auriculotherapy is easy to use and available now to everyone!  The ear as a microcosm (a reflection of the entire human body), is often used as a distal method to treat ailments.  

These 33 charts may help you treat the following major common complaints at home using ear seeds/pellets, finger massage &/or a spring-loaded ear probe: 

Acne, Alcoholism, Allergy, Anxiety, Back Pain, Cancer, Carpal Tunnel, Chronic Fatigue, Common Cold, Constipation, Cough, Depression, Diarrhea, Drug Addiction, Fibromyalgia, Headaches, Hypertension, Hyperthyroidism, Infertility, Insomnia, Memory Loss, PMS, Sciatica, Shoulder Pain, Smoking, Sore Throat, Stress, Stroke, Tennis Elbow, Tinnitus, TMJ, Toothache, and Weight Loss.  

Dr. Mom's Ear Charts App is a handy way for people to take their healthcare home!  

Disclaimer: These charts are intended for use as an educational tool only, and do not claim to cure any of the above ailments. They are in no way to be regarded as a substitution for proper medical care by a licensed primary care physician.

comments: This app is great to use with my Electric Acupuncture Pen. One suggestion, I see you have pressure points for Hyperthyroidism but not HYPOthyroidism. Can you add pressure points FOR Hypothyroidism?

This app provides useful auriculartherapy points for common ailments. The font used is quite small, however. I was unable to enlarge the picture on my Samsung S9 which is why I gave it 4 stars instead if 5.

Great app. You need a background in Chinese medicine and ear acupuncture, but once you have the background its nice to play around with this app and check out the point combos here. It seems fun for all levels, but especially if you're a beginner at ear acupuncture and want to dive deeper.
Yay, love having the point names!! Nicely done! This is a good resource for me to maximize my point locations in the ear.
Easy to use and clear point description for conditions! Definitely a must have!

title: Hearing test, Audiogram
descriptionHTML:
It is hard to realize that you have problems with your hearing. Regular monitoring of your hearing with the help of our application can assess the level of your hearing and reduce the anxiety you feel thinking about its condition.

FEATURES:
-- graphic representation of test results and text description;
-- test hearing conducted with the help of 8 tone signals of different frequencies (from 125 Hz to 8000 Hz);
-- control of hearing changes by comparison with previous results;
-- comparison of test results with the norm for your age;
-- comparison of test results with results of another person;
-- sending test results by email to a doctor;
-- exporting test results for automatic adjustment of the application Petralex hearing aid.

Note (denial of responsibility):
The application is not a piece of medical equipment or software with corresponding certification and does not replace hearing test conducted by a specialist. The results of test hearing in the Application cannot be used as a basis for diagnosis.
summary: Hearing analyzer. Ear age test
recentChanges:
In the 2.0.1 we improved the app stability and fixed crashes.
-- Quick test – just 2 minutes
-- Advanced Hearing Test
-- Personal recommendations
-- User-friendly results
comments: Easy and straight forward to do the actual test but the results are confusing. I said I have worse hearing than most people my age but all the little icons were green so what makes it worse??

It works as expected, nevertheless its accuracy could be improved by separating the various test steps with a visual cue. Sometimes one reacts with delay due to distraction or surprise effects, therefore a monitoring of the delays could give an indication whether its better to redo the test for a consistent result.

does exactly what it says. no adverts. I recommend to exchange the headphones round from left to right and try again to minimise the effect of unbalanced volume if any and compare the results. well done..

The tests begin at an audible level, then ramp up quickly, making the result irrelevant. However, there's lots of analysis to put results in context. It's a very slick design, but the guy who ordered the screens should probably be doing something else for a while.
Thanks, I one day noticed that my earphones right side sounded louder I did some research and them found that maybe I had hearing loss. I came to this and now I know that I have slight hearing loss.

title: Zen: Relax, Meditate & Sleep
description:
If you want to live a happier, healthier and more balanced emotional life, Zen is the perfect app for you. On Google's list of 'Best apps of 2016', Zen offers a diverse and ever-growing amount of content and features, such as: 

· Weekly new Guided Meditations for relaxation, deep sleep, mood improvement, anxiety relief, stress reduction, focus at work and much more.

Great meditations! My son and I use it every morning. He's 7 with ADD and it does wonders!
Amazing app, the best for variety. So many options to choose from.

title: inTAKT
description:
Music Therapy against Tinnitus

People who suffer from Tinnitus know how stressful it is and, unfortunately, they are often told that there is no solution to such a problem.
Tinnitus stresses the affected person, stealing his/her quality of life. The unstoppable buzzing disturbs the daily or work routine on a large scale and even comes to destroy professional careers. The constant noise disrupts concentration, steals the focus, performance, reasoning ability and joy of living of the individual.

Free of Tinnitus and other discomforts through music? Yes, it’s possible!

Download the free InTakt app on your phone and choose from the examples of tinnitus there which one is your “nasty companion”. Sign up, pay the monthly fee and you will be armed with a valuable weapon to fight Tinnitus or another annoying issue in your life.
For Tinnitus, click on one of the sound to which your tinnitus belongs and you are automatically choosing which kind of binaural beats composed by the Maestro will be your music therapy. In the first three weeks, you will notice the difference!

Duration of therapy
The treatment lasts for 12 months. During this period you will hear 12 pieces of music with different binaural beats. Each music will accompany you for 30 days, at which point the next song in your music group will automatically play, and so on up to music 12.
The longer the music therapy is used, the better the effects and its success. 

Scientifically proven
MRC Institute of Hearing Research is intensively dedicated to the problem of Tinnitus, working in accordance with the parameters of the National Study of Hearing. 
Our brain has the ability to reorganize itself, develop new branches and thus to change. We know that tinnitus is subjective in nature, i.e., sometimes the sound is not real – it’s a ghost noise that happens because some nerve cells in the auditory center of the brain are super active.
Binaural Beats therapy stimulates some nerve centers in the brain to produce some special frequencies while the brain itself learns a new behavior. In this sequence, the nerve cells that were super active calm down and submit to the new, reorganized brain behavior. 

Did you detect the tinnitus that bothers you, registered and made the payment?
Now, with headphones that can be either open or closed, you can comfortably do your therapy on the couch, in a park or in your bedroom before going to sleep. It is important that you focus on the binaural beats music. Do not be distracted by reading a book or any other task, and listen 1 or 2 times a day for 30 minutes.

* Do not stress if a “worsening” occurs – this is normal, just like with homeopathic treatments.

You don’t have tinnitus? You're a lucky guy! Choose from other therapies that of your interest, such as meditation, panic disorder, burnout and others.

InTakt app offers a test version for you to know the style of our music with binaural beats.
 
Social security agreements do not (yet) cover this type of therapy without prior consultation. Talk to your doctor who can attest the condition and with your health insurance company to evaluate the possibility of coverage.
Learn more by visiting our website: https://www.cerebralmusic.com.br/ 

Use InTakt app at your own risk.
If you suffer from Epilepsy, do not use our therapies without consulting your doctor!
